SigResChair: グートルーンのために貝殻探せ言われてんねんけどな...砂の上に転がっとらん限り、見つけられる気せえへんわ。$1
SigResBar: ハリケーン三杯いってもてな、まだまだ飲める気するわ、{{LPJobTitle}}。ヒマだったら一緒にどうや？$1
SigResTowel: また日焼けしてまいそうや。いつもこうやねん。ロブスター並みに真っ赤っかやで。$1
SigResTowel2: %シグは寝ながら、どこかで聞いた映画の歌をつぶやいている。『言えることは...そう、潮も、太陽も、空も...オレのおかげ〜』
SigResTowel3: %シグはタトゥーの上に、丁寧に日焼け止めを塗りこんでいる。
SigResort: ここに家持っとるんか、@？ベア家の真似みたいやな。『土地ごとに家、海ごとに船』ってやつや。
Sigurd.PolyMod.CantDate: Eh, that's kind of unfair to your partner, isn't it?
Sigurd.PolyMod.CantMarry: Not to be that guy, but if your partner isn't okay with your intentions, you shouldn't try to bypass 'em.
Sigurd.RejectBouquet.AlreadyAccepted.Eng: 残念やな、@。そない簡単に彼氏に格下げできる思たらアカンで。$18
Sigurd.RejectBouquet.AlreadyAccepted.Mar: ん？もっとデートしたい言うんか？ええで、@。$10
Sigurd.RejectBouquet.AlreadyAccepted.Def: 最初にもろたやつ、ちゃんと持ってるで。二回も聞かんでええんや。$18
Sigurd.RejectMermaidPendant.AlreadyAccep: ん？デジャヴやな。これ前にも聞かれた気ぃするで、@。$18
おぉ、もう一回誓い合うんか？そら素敵な宴やな。ええやん、やろか。$10
首はひとつしかないんや、@。せやけど、あんたがそこまで言うなら...$18
Sigurd.Dialogue.Summit.2: この{{BearFamProfanityD}}谷全体が見渡せるやん。ほんま、たまらん景色やろ？$18
Sigurd.Dialogue.Summit.3: こうして前を見とると、逆に過去も思い出すな。$18"/pause 1000/speak spouse "この谷で、オレら...ひとりとしても、ふたりとしても、山あり谷ありやったなぁ。$10
Sigurd.Dialogue.Summit.4: せやけど、もう出発点からずいぶん遠くまで来たんやな、@。$18
Sigurd.Dialogue.Summit.5: 昔な、軍隊を出たあとに自分の未来を考えたとき、怖なって、いつでも逃げ出せるよう身構えてたんや。#$b#せやけど今、もし逃げるとしたら...真っ先に走っていく先は、あんたのとこや、{{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}。オレのほんまに大事で、オレが望んだ未来やからな。$4"/pause 500/speak MadDog.HashtagBearFam.Sigurd "あんたはオレにとって、この{{BearFamProfanityD}}世界のてっぺんや。愛してるで、@。$4
Sigurd.Dialogue.Children.1: オレら、ほんま運のええ家族やなぁ...{0}はきっとオレらのお守りやで。$1
Sigurd.Dialogue.Children.2: {0}...おまえは両親にどんだけ愛されとるか、絶対に忘れんといてな、min skatt（オレの宝物）。$1
Sigurd.Dialogue.Children.Second.1: あのちっこい独裁者らが来る前の生活なんて、もう覚えてへんわ...せやけど、来てくれてほんま良かったと思てる。$1
Sigurd.Dialogue.Children.Second.2: 人生のピースがきれいに全部そろった気ぃするわ――あんた、子どもら、{{BearFamProfanityA}}、そんで不思議なことにオレ自身まで。$18
Sigurd.Dialogue.Engagement.First: オレほど幸せもんはおらんわ。はよあんたの旦那になりたいんや、@。きっとお互いええ相手になれるはずや。$4
Sigurd.Dialogue.Engagement.Second: なぁ、{{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}、その気になったらオレがハネムーンに連れてったるで。$10#$b#...まぁ、%farmを長いこと離れる気はあらへんのはわかっとる。$18#$b#しゃあないやろ？男は一回は言うてみたいんや。$10
Sigurd.Dialogue.Engagement.Third: まずは明日やな。その先には...永遠が待っとるんや。$4
Message.Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Mines.02: {{CPSigurdSpouseNameA}}！いったい{{BearFamProfanityA}}何があったんや？大丈夫か？
Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Mines.03: ここから出よ、@...$8#$b#あんたに何かあって、オレが守れへんかったら...{{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}...オレどうしたらええかわからん...$2#$b#まずは家に帰ってしっかり休んで...戻るのはそれからにしてくれや。
Message.Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Skull.02: おい...無理すんな、ゆっくりや。
Harvey.Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Skull.03: @、本当に助かったよ。シグルドが間に合わなければ、もっと深刻な状態になっていたかもしれない。$2
Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Skull.04: もう二度と目ぇ開かんのちゃうか思たで、{{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}...$8#$b#ほんまに心臓止まるくらい怖かったんや...$2
Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Skull.05: {{CPSigurdSpouseNameA}}！何考えとったんや、あんなとこで捕まるなんて...$2#$b#オレ、あんた失うとこやったんやぞ！$8
Harvey.Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Skull.06: 落ち着いてくれ、シグルド。@はもう目を開けた、それだけで十分回復の兆しだよ。
Harvey.Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Skull.07: 君たち二人に少し時間をあげよう。その間に私は事務処理を済ませてくるよ。
Sigurd.PlayerKilled.Skull.08: 悪かったな、{{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}...オレが後ろ守って、あんたが自分の足で出てこれるようにしたるべきやった...$8#$b#もう二度とあんな姿見たない。あんた守れるなら、この{{BearFamProfanityD}}砂漠ごとぶっ壊したってかまへん。$2
Sigurd.Dialogue.Marriage.1: @がペリカンタウンに来たとき、{{LPPN1}}がこの町に馴染めるかどうか、誰にもわかりませんでした。#$b#しかし今日からは、@も私たちと同じ大切な仲間です。$h#$b#本日{1}の{0}、ここに@と%spouseを夫婦として結ぶことを、大きな名誉といたします。
Sigurd.Dialogue.Marriage.2: @...%spouse...#$b# ペリカンタウンの町長として、二人が正式に結ばれたことをここに宣言し、心からお祝い申し上げます。
SigSpring18: 明日はおばちゃんの誕生日や。花が好きやから、悩んだらそれでええで。#$b#ちなみにまた50歳になるらしいわ。$10
SigSpring27.true: あしたはテレンの誕生日やな...あいつ、どうせ派手で大げさなんを期待しとるんやろ。しゃあない、応えてやるか。$18
SigSpring27.false: あしたはテレンの誕生日やな...忘れたら大騒ぎされるわ...ったく{{BearFamProfanityA}}。$18
SigFall1: 収穫の時期が来たな、@。この季節が終わったらオレのハチらも冬眠や。#$b#冬のあいだ、オレは何したらええんやろな？
SigFall18: 今夜は宿に寄って、グンと一緒にビリヤードやろや。オレらの誕生日なんや。$1#$b#いや、双子ちゃうで。うちの親が...まぁ『決まった時期に熱心やった』、っちゅう話や。$11
SigWinter23: あしたはグートルーンの誕生日やな。けど何も用意せんでええで、次の日が冬の祭りやしな。$10#$b#ふふ、こう言うとグートルーンはめっちゃ嫌がるんやけどな。$18
SigWinter28: 来年ハチのために新しい花植えんの、楽しみやわ。#$b#気に入ってくれるとええんやけどな。$3
SigSpring12: 従軍しとったときは祝日なんてなかったわ。エッグハントの代わりに靴下丸めて隠しとったんや。$1#$b#まぁ...ニオイは卵と大して変わらんからな。$18
SigSpring23: ただの田舎のダンスパーティーやなくて...なんかアレな感じの儀式でも混じっとるんちゃうか？#$b#見てみぃ、@。青組と白組に分かれとるやろ？どうにも怪しいわ。
SigSummer10: いや、集まりには行かん。知事は戦争を支持しとるって公言しとるしな、それだけで殴ってまいそうや。$2#$b#代わりにオレの分も謎スープ楽しんどいてや！$1
SigSummer27: ゴトロに古い言い伝えがあってな、月光クラゲの夢を見て、翌晩にそれを実際に見られたら、その年はずっと幸運なんやと。$2#$b#ええ話やろ？$1
SigFall15: 明日は祭りやから、ようけ人が町に来るで。#$b#オレか？飲んで隠れとくわ。#$b#でもあんたの展示品は見に行く、人混みに流されへんかったらな。$1
SigFall26: 昔は母さんに、グンとおそろいの衣装を着せられとったんや、スピリットイブのたんびに。$11#$b#でもグートルーンは好きな仮装ができたんや。ずるいやっちゃ。$1
SigWinter7: 冬の釣りはピアスが冷えて痛むんや。$2#$b#せやから明日はグンに任せて、オレは凍傷にならんようにあったかくしとくわ。$1
SigWinter.1: あのゴトロの密輸人、ほんまに町に来とるんや。$8#$b#話しかけたいけど...オレは黙っとくべきやろな。まぁ、それが筋や。
SigWinter.2: グートルーンが潜水艦ある言うとったで？$8#$b#真夜中イカも見たらしいわ。$1#$b#クジラとかクラーケンとか、なんかすごいもん見られへんかな？$1
SigWinter.3: @、ほかのもんはどうでもええ、この潜水艦ツアーが最高に{{BearFamProfanityD}}やわ。$1
SigWinter24: 秘密のプレゼント交換って、ちょっとかわいいやん。ありがたいことに、オレはチョロいで。Jojaコーラ一本でイチコロや。$1#$b#...まぁ、ほんまは恥ずかしい話やけどな。$18
Sigurd.Birthday.ED.Eli: Moray has a birthday? You mean that lunatic didn't just spawn from the soil of some deep dark cave and break free one day? Well, I reckon I'll have to wish him well tomorrow.$18
Sigurd.Birthday.ED.Dylan.true: Hm, I wonder if Dylan would want to take a trip, just the two of us, since it's Dylan Day tomorrow...$4#$b#It's a bit last minute, but if I suggest a big enough aquarium, he just might take the bait.$10
Sigurd.Birthday.ED.Dylan.false: Unlike my fish-brained baby sister, it oughtta be pretty easy to pick out a birthday gift for Dylan... Even if it is *tomorrow* and I haven't even begun to look.$18
Sigurd.Birthday.ROB.Rodney: Hm, Auntie's been busy in the kitchen and won't let me steal any bites... she's making something to drop off at O'Brien's place tomorrow, isn't she?$18
Sigurd.Birthday.NtH.Nora: It's Nora Day tomorrow. Give her something nice, or else.#[220 234 608]
Sigurd.Birthday.DiTR.Eve: Probably will be swinging 'round to Eve's place to wish her well tomorrow... might bring her snack. Or maybe just a snack for Waffle.$1
Sigurd.Birthday.DiTR.Trace: What does Trace even want as a birthday gift? Unfettered access to every blackberry bush in a sixty mile radius? Cat-sized shorts? A shorts-sized cat?$18
Sigurd.Birthday.SnS.Mateo.true: Mateo probably won't even take it easy tomorrow, even though it's literally Mateo Day... I guess I should stop by with a drink, at least.$18
Sigurd.Birthday.SnS.Cirrus.true: Well, if I meet up with Cirrus tomorrow, I'll get her a round of fruit juice or two or three. S'least I can do to be neighborly.$1#$b#Besides, she might have some kind of snack to share with me - and I'm not above being bribed by pretty musicians for future endeavors.$18
Sigurd.Birthday.SnS.Mateo.false: I swear I've told myself to check the weather for tomorrow five times already and I keep spacing it. Must be one of those days.
Sigurd.Birthday.SnS.Cirrus.false: Feels like it might be kind of cloudy tomorrow... Should I lurk around inside or venture out anyway, that's the real question.
Sigurd.Birthday.MGC.Cambria: Camie Day is tomorrow - she has an unusual appetite but since I can't cook, I'll probably cheat and give her some flowers - or {{BearFamProfanityA}}, pick her up some coffee.$18
Sigurd.Birthday.SVE.Andy: Running a case of beer up to Andy tomorrow morning. I'd offer to help with his fields but he won't take a 'hand-out' even if it's meant as a gift.$18
Sigurd.Birthday.RSV.Shiro: If you run into Shiro tomorrow, make sure to give him something for his birthday. He's a good guy.$1#[241]
SigurdMountainEntry1: やっと静かになったな。
SigurdMountainEntry3: 今日サングラス持ってくりゃよかったわ。
SigurdMountainEntry4: えらい登り坂やったな。
SigurdSaloonEntry2: ちょっと寄ったで、ガス！
SigurdSaloonEntry3: とりあえず二杯な、ガス。
SigurdSaloonEntry4: 注文してたやつ取りに来たで、ガス！
SigurdMuseumEntry3: 悪い、これ返すんちょっと遅なったわ。
SigurdMuseumEntry4: なぁギュンター、貸出期限いつまでやったっけ？
SigurdScienceHouseEntry1: 標本持ってきたで、ディメトリウス！
SigurdScienceHouseEntry2: 今日の予定は何や、ボス？
SigurdScienceHouseEntry3: ようロビン、オレのオノもうできた？
SigurdESVillageEntry1: 天気、このままもってくれたらええけどな...
SigurdESVillageEntry3: またライター忘れてもうた、{{BearFamProfanityD}}。
SigurdESVillageEntry4: 今日は海がなんか不気味やな...
SigurdTownEntry1: 今日はあんまり混んでへんとええけどな...
SigurdTownEntry2: 今の...木のとこから走って出たん何や？
SigurdTownEntry3: 帰ったらエロイーズに、あの鳥なんやったか聞いてみよか...
SigDialogue04.1: 軍隊の宣伝なんか、オレがせんでも向こうが勝手にやっとるわ。$11#$b#戦争そのものはひどいもんやけど、ゴトロの人らはほんまにええ人ばっかや。$9#$b#あんな連中...兵士どもに国を荒らされるなんて、かわいそうにな。
SigDialogue04.2: この谷、退屈すぎてな。空飛ぶ魔女とか、地下に店構えてる生きもんとか出てきてもええくらいやろ。#$b#ズズにはそんなの、おらんかったしな。$11#$b#...いや、今のズズなら、逆におってもおかしないかもな、{{BearFamProfanityA}}。
SigDialogue04.3: あんた、農場始める前は何してたんや？#$b#...Jojaで働いとったんか？$8#$b#オレも兵士からハチ飼いになった身やけど、会社勤めから田舎暮らしってのも、なかなかの転身やな。
SigDialogue04.4: よう、@。...なんやその顔、普通にあいさつしただけやで？#$b#友達つくりたいならサルーン行きぃや。#$b#%シグはポケットからボロボロのペーパーバックを取り出して開いた。表紙には『ポエム』の文字が見える。
SigDialogue04.5: この谷の土はコーヒー豆がよう育つらしいで。#$b#残念やけど、オレ、コーヒー苦手やねん。カフェイン中毒やのに、弱点はソーダや。#$b#妹はそれ聞いたら大喜びするわ。背伸びんようになるって言うても聞かへんけどな。$18
SigDialogue04.6: ...おばちゃんが、オレ探してあんた寄こしたんか？ ...は？自分の意思で来たん？$8#$b#ほな、好きにしたらええわ。オレなんか見てもおもろないで。
SigDialogue04.7: この前ガスとクラフトビールの話してな。結局、だいぶ飲んでもうたけど。#$b#まぁ、ちょっと二日酔いや。いつか学習するやろ。$7#$b#%シグは手を振って、会話を打ち切った。
SigDialogue04.8: オレは三人兄弟の長男や。弟はすぐ下で、妹はまだ子どもやな。#$b#あいつ、オレの年のころよりずっと賢いわ。$1#$b#しかも気が強い。チャンスあったら、資本家に爆竹投げつけるタイプや。$18
SigDialogue04.9: バーンズがな、退役軍人の特典でセラピー行け言うてきよったんや。#$b#けど、行ったとこで得るもんなんかあらへん。知らんやつの前でアホ面さらすだけや。$5#$b#あいつはメンタルの話になると止まらんタイプやねん。
SigDialogue04.10: 博物館、どうも苦手や。明かり少ないし、本棚ばっかで息詰まる。$2#$b#谷が危ない場所やないのはわかっとるけど、本読むとこがあそこしかないのがな...。#$b#しかも本の状態ボロボロやし、ほんま{{BearFamProfanityD}}もったいないわ。$2
SigDialogue04.11: Aunt Sondra's an accountant by trade. Terrifyingly brilliant with numbers, actually.#$b#You thought she was a musician? Nah, my uncle was the musician, she's just an incredibly tone-deaf music fan.$1#$b#Don't tell her I said that.$10
SigDialogue04.12: Penny's a smart cookie, huh? And a busy bee, wrangling those kids.$1#$b#Huh? Oh! No, no, nothing like that, guys like me don't mix well with girls like that.$8#$b#I just think she's an all-around good person.$18
SigDialogue04.13: I don't think I've ever wanted to go to worship.#$b#I don't know if I even believe in Yoba, to be honest.$11#$b#The Book of Yoba has some interesting passages though. Song of Songs is practically a love poem, if you ignore the religious aspect.$1
SigDialogue04.14: Pierre's or Joja's? Well... Ah, I order everything through Jojazon, to be honest.$11#$b#You get limited edition Joja Cola flavors faster that way.$1#$b#And honestly, I don't know if I could quit caffeine that easily.#$b#I know, I know, support local businesses. You sound like Gudrun.$18
SigDialogue04.15: The minecart system seems really inclusive.$8#$b#It's too bad it's mostly underground, I wanna try it out.$2It'd be like a rollercoaster at a theme park, right?
SigDialogue04.16: Even after being discharged, I still get promotional materials in the mail.#$b#It's like they forgot they're the ones who determined I was medically unfit.#$b#I'd probably re-enlist, otherwise... I mean, a man's gotta work for a living somehow, right?$2
SigDialogue04.17: We don't grow much at the Lodge.#$b#Flowers for the bees, there's a fersken tree I guess...#$b#But you grow all kinds of things, right? Auntie raves about your produce, so you're good at it too, huh.$1#$b#Rare occasion in which 'don't quit your day job' would've been actual bad advice, I suppose.$18
SigDialogue04.18: Do you think it's weird Pierre has a place of worship tuck into his shop but keeps the shop open on Sundays?#$b#Blasphemous, almost.$18
SigDialogue04.19: I'm not a Joja guy exactly but we did get Joja cola in their stupid corporate branded care packages, and I *am* a caffeine guy.#$b#Creature of habit type guy, I guess. Maybe someday I'll quit and stop giving them money.#$b#Bet Gudrun would stop nagging me so much, too.$1
SigDialogue04.20: What do you think tonight's special is? Gus sure knows his way around a recipe book.$1#$b#Kinda really forgot how good food could be, until after my discharge.#$b#Even the hospital food during my recovery was better, pfft.$18
SigDialogue04.21: Why beekeeping? Honestly, I was supposed to get a support animal.#$b#I think there's folks out there that need one more than I do, so I got a massive bumblebee hive back at the family manor, and my gran *lost her mind*.$18#$b#Auntie remembered the family Lodge, and now my bees and I are here, causing minimal trouble.$1
SigDialogue04.22: Are you a beer person, a wine person, or something else? I'll buy you a round some time.$11#b#Me? I like craft beer and cocktails, and Emily makes a great whiskey cola, but that means lurking around the Saloon.$2
SigDialogue04.23: I was a {{BearFamProfanityH}} out of high school - star athlete, scouted by Zuzu CU? I was allowed to do anything I wanted with zero repercussions.$1#$b#The Army sorted me out real quick.#$b#I bet you were a troublemaker though.$10
SigDialogue04.24: I kinda assumed Clint only made like, swords and other nonsense, but he actually can make jewelry. Guess who's getting new snakebites?$1#$b#Do you think he's ever made anything for Emily? Heh.$18
SigDialogue04.25: Gran called me up and yelled at me for not visiting, the old bat.#$b#So I sent her a postcard. Good enough, right?$9
SigDialogue04.26: I don't get the whole rah-rah-patriotism thing. I didn't enlist because I'm a patriot, that's for sure.#$b#And serving in the military wasn't some noble calling. I only enlisted because it made Gran mad. Made Uncle Wulf sad, too but...$2
SigDialogue04.27: Penny's got a great to-be-read list. Not all the books are available through the Museum yet so I'm ordering them to throw Gunther's way.#$b#Eh, it's not strictly *for* her, I'm going to read 'em before I donate 'em.$18
SigDialogue04.28: Robin finally accepted that I won't take payment for helping around the shop so instead she invites to me stay for dinner.#$b#It's tempting, and god knows Demetrius always has interesting things from his research to talk about...$1#$b#But I feel like some kind of invasive species, so I always decline.$2
SigDialogue04.29: Got a letter from my folks. They're back in the homeland, where the family business started out of Trondhjem.$1#$b#I've been a few times as a kid, but my great-grandparents moved most the business to Zuzu City here in Ferngill and us kids had to apply for dual citizenship instead of getting it naturally.$11
SigDialogue04.30: Thought Auntie was going to boot me out of the house this morning... I uh, burned water.$9#$b#I don't *know* how!$8#$b#I haven't done that poorly in the kitchen since I was a dumb teenager!$8
SigDialogue04.Spring.1: Y'know, I moved here because my Gran wouldn't let me put beehives on the main property.#$b#Meaning, I'd like to spend time with the bees that I fled the city for.#$b#And yet here you are, not letting me spend time with them.$11
SigDialogue04.Spring.2: Do my lip piercings hurt? Only when it gets real cold.#$b#I got them done during a winter in a little town in the hills in southern Gotoro.#$b#My Gran hates 'em, though.$18
SigDialogue04.Spring.3: Spring's easily the best season. Easy marching weather.#$b#And the ground's soft enough to bury seeds. Or anything, really.#$b#We should just stick to seeds.$9
SigDialogue04.Spring.4: Sell my honey? Just get your own bees, {{LPJobTitle}}!$9#$b#I can loan you my beekeeping books even, if you need 'em. Or Gunther could probably find you something in that tattered collection at the museum.
SigDialogue04.Spring.5: Salmonberry season's definitely the high point of spring. More than enough berries for jelly and wine.$1#$b#I have *no* idea how to make jelly or wine, tragically.#$b#Definitely brings out the bears, though.$10#$b#I'd fight a bear for a jar of jam, for sure.$18
SigDialogue04.Summer.1: I can't believe Gran really said Gun and Gudrun could come out here.$9#$b#Maybe they're only staying for the summer. Otherwise that's too many Bears in the house.#$b#%Despite his words, Sig doesn't really seem mad that his siblings are close by.
SigDialogue04.Summer.2: I'm looking forward to playing catch with Alex later.#$b#I got scouted out of high school to play for Zuzu CU but joined the army instead. And we see how well that turned out.$2#$b#Playing professional or even semi-pro gridball would suit Alex, though. And he wants it, which is always a good trait in an athlete.$1
SigDialogue04.Summer.3: Aunt Sondra drives Gun and Gudrun back to Zuzu to see our grandmother every Friday. They won't be back until supper time.#$b#Everything's too dense and too tall in the city, it's too much for me.#$b#Honestly, so is the Saloon.$2
SigDialogue04.Summer.4: @! Go sit in the shade with some water, for god's sake, you're bright red.$8#$b#S'like marching with the {{BearFamProfanityD}} platoon all over again.
SigDialogue04.Summer.5: Sort of think I should do conditioning training with Alex but I think we'd collapse of heatstroke long before we saw any benefits.#$b#We could make it like endurance contest though, that could be fun... Hm...$1
SigDialogue04.Fall.1: Never had to rake when I lived in the city.#$b#Didn't have to in the Army, neither. Hate it now.
SigDialogue04.Fall.2: School's barely started up and Gudrun's trying to get out of it.#$b#I was the same way when I was her age.$18
SigDialogue04.Fall.3: I started chopping wood to stock up, right? Come to find out, Robin sells it!$8#$b#My whole body hurts and it was entirely avoidable!#$b#I mean, it gave me an excuse to be out of the house, but {{BearFamProfanityD}} if that's not an exercise in futility.
SigDialogue04.Fall.4: This time of year it seems like all kinds of so-called magical beings pop up.#$b#I don't care one way or the other, but a lot of 'em make my hearing aid going absolutely nuts.#$b#I'm sure it's not magic, it's probably something they're wearing... Right?$8
SigDialogue04.Fall.5: I was deployed for a while in a very flat part of Gotoro, and the fields of wheat looked like an ocean of molten gold during autumn.#$b#They don't really have the same superstitions around pumpkins but apparently pumpkin pie novelty candy was a huge deal.$1#$b#I can still taste the artificial ginger and nutmeg.
SigDialogue04.Winter.1: Am I going home for the holidays? Honestly, I'd be surprised if they wanted the family disappointment around.#$b#Of course, it might be fun to argue with Gran some more.
SigDialogue04.Winter.2: I hear there are bears deeper in the woods.$8#$b#I kind of wanna go find one... What? They're hibernating, it's safe. Probably.
SigDialogue04.Winter.3: Winter's a good time to change things up. Maybe get another tattoo.#$b#Something tasteful or something tacky, that's the hard question.$18
SigDialogue04.Winter.4: %Sig is carrying a book he picked up from the library. He looks a little sheepish, and when you get closer you can tell he dropped it in a snowdrift recently.#$b#Don't rat me out!$8
SigDialogue04.Winter.5: %When you draw near Sig, he's covered in snow and pine needles.#$b#Hm? Hey @. Been helping Robin with marking trees for treatment come spring.#$b#She said something about needlecast which sounds made up for a fantasy video game, if you ask me.$11
SigDialogue610.1: We oughtta build a school.#$b#{{IsLewisMayor1}}$11#$b#Just thinking out loud... {{IsLewisMayor2}}$18
SigDialogue610.2: No, I don't think I'm suited for civilian life. Nothing makes it better.$2#$b#Not the bees, not the Valley.$2#$b#Maybe I'll be this way forever.$7
SigDialogue610.3: The Stardrop's noisy but I can always go skulk at the Inn. Rosa doesn't seem to mind.$1
SigDialogue610.4: %Sig stares right through you. He seems to be lost in thought.#$b#Oh, sorry, @. Feeling a little useless today.$7
SigDialogue610.5: Y'know what sucks about living out here?#$b#I gotta carry my cigarette butts around 'til I find a trash can.$5#$b#I get lectured about smoking enough as it is, but now there's always ash in my pockets.$9
SigDialogue610.6: Bear family trait, none of us can cook. Auntie can because she married into the family.$1#$b#Oh she and Mom tried to teach us but we're all like nonstick pans.#$b#It didn't stick.$18
SigDialogue610.7: Auntie tricked me into talking to my grandmother on the phone last night. I don't know why, she doesn't like the ol' battleaxe either.#$b#Don't get me wrong, I love Gran but we're oil and water.
SigDialogue610.8: I'll never get my hearing back on this side without medical intervention, and even then it's not guaranteed.#$b#%Sig points at his hearing aid.#$b#War takes so much from people - in comparison I got off light.#$b#Sometimes I don't think I should have...$2
SigDialogue610.9: If you see my Aunt Sondra, be prepared.#$b#She's trying to convince Gus to update the choices in the jukebox, so she's surveying everyone's music tastes.$9#$b#I prefer pop music but I have a feeling I might be in the minority.#$b#Pfft, don't tell me you believe me?$10
SigDialogue610.10: The Lodge gets pretty quiet once everyone leaves for Zuzu. It's real peaceful.
SigDialogue610.11: I think Eloise and Gudrun are onto some kind of bird-fish fact exchange scheme.#$b#Regardless, I've learned too much about both topics.$18
SigDialogue610.12: Gun wants me to spot him in the mines but...$2#$b#His heart's in the right place, I just don't think I should shadowing him his whole life. Not fair to him, right?#$b#...Nevermind what happened *last* time I was in a cave.$2
SigDialogue610.13: Been up at the bathhouse, spotting Alex.#$b#He's got an insane bench press.$8#$b#No, I'm not jealous, I could get there if I put in the effort. I mean, there's not really a reason for me to stay in shape anymore, other than habit.
SigDialogue610.14: Sorry if I seem worn out. Marnie asked if I'd help her muck out the barn, and it wasn't like I had anything better to do.#$b#I wonder if I'd make a good ranch hand in another life?
SigDialogue610.15: The architect we hired to update the Lodge did a swell job.#$b#Robin did the labor and I guess had all kinds of helpful tricks to improve the build 'for generations to come'.#$b#It pays to have a sharp carpenter like Robin around. I wonder how much of the town's upkeep she's had a hand in?$8
SigDialogue610.16: I guess I accidentally directed my book order to the family estate.$8#$b#Gun'll make sure I get it, but I'm still kicking myself for sending it to the wrong address.
SigDialogue610.17: Gun's been fighting a lot of monsters. Can you fight monsters?$8#$b#You're far braver than you look.$11#$b#That didn't sound like a compliment? Well, it was a half-compliment, technically. You and Gun don't seem to have any self-preservation instincts though.$9
SigDialogue610.18: If there's one topic Teren loves to complain about, it's his luck with dating apps.$18#$b#He's got some of the most harrowing stories I've ever had to hear.#$b#And he's a handsome dude so he's definitely got the advantage in those situations. I can't imagine how awful it is for women.$8
SigDialogue610.19: One thing that's helpful about being home is actually being able to play games when they release.#$b#During deployment, I'd get spoilers from Gun in letters all while praying we'd camp near a town for once.$9
SigDialogue610.20: Got a letter from my parents. They're still in Trondhjem... I kind of think they'll be there for life.#$b#It's weird, but it's not like it's impossible to go visit 'em.#$b#They're family business people for life, though, so who knows if they'd have time for a visit?$8
SigDialogue610.21: I think I'd be an alright sailor.$11#$b#I mean, I'm not just saying that because of the whole 'Nors' thing - I mean I don't get seasick and I'm pretty sturdy and reliable...$8#$b#Y'think Willy wants a deckhand or two? Me and Gun can make a boy's day of it.$18
SigDialogue610.22: Gun swiped some of my cologne.#$b#I wouldn't really care but *apparently* slimes like it so he got swarmed down in the mines...$11#$b#I know, I know, I shouldn't laugh, but that's what he gets for using my stuff.$18
SigDialogue610.23: Teren's the better storyteller by far out of us two, but I think the time and distance has made his memories fuzzy.#$b#Not that he *lies*, but he sure remembers things more positively than I do.$9
SigDialogue610.24: I haven't been very adventurous with giving my bees different flower beds to feed off of.#$b#In a perfect world, the peach blossoms would be sufficient, but I can't help but wonder about other, better options...$3
SigDialogue610.25: Auntie thinks we oughtta remodel the kitchen.$11#$b#I'm not *opposed* to the labor but she's going to want opinions on every last little bit.$9#$b#I think I've proven time and time again that my tastes in anything is pretty much dismal.
SigDialogue610.Spring.1: I was thinking I might stop by %farm sometime today.#$b#Nah, I won't mess up your work. Just wanna see what you've got going on. Maybe sit in your field and stare at the sun.#$b#Just till around me. Or put me to work even, if you could use the spare hand.$1
SigDialogue610.Spring.2: Everything is so green.$8#$b#They don't tell you how much you'll miss the green.$8#$b#%Sig looks very surprised before he mumbles a line from a poem.#$b#...'The earth does not withhold, it is generous enough'.
SigDialogue610.Spring.3: I'm still not a hundred percent sure what flowers result in the best mead, and I hate taking more than I need from my bees.$11#$b#Spring really could do with being a touch longer, hm?
SigDialogue610.Spring.4: Gun's allergies have been driving him - and the rest of us - completely batty.#$b#I expect we'll have to unearth from a pile of wadded up tissues soon, still sniffling and sneezing all the while.$18
SigDialogue610.Spring.5: I asked Teren if he'd be free later to buzz through Close Whisper 5 with me again but he said it's too nice out to play horror game.$8#$b#I don't see what the weather has to do with playing a video game.$11
SigDialogue610.Summer.1: Summer's barely started and I'm already sweating all the time.$2#$b#Any poems about being hot? Let me think... #$b#'For what, oh, what, is worldly heat, unto the heat of hell?'$18#$b#What, that one's too grim? Hey, you asked.$18
SigDialogue610.Summer.3: Gudrun's skipping out on her chores again. I'd let that girl get away with murder, but leaving the dishes for me is unacceptable.#$b#%Sig rolls his eyes as he moves off presumably to lecture his baby sister.
SigDialogue610.Summer.4: Gudrun doesn't have classes during the summer, so she tries to do everything at once.#$b#She's like you, kinda.#$b#Real annoying, too.$5#$b#My kid sister, not you!$8
SigDialogue610.Summer.5: Do you think Alex knows anything about making ice cream?$1#$b#Like maybe, honey ice cream? Surely it's possible. Surely, I can con him into doing me the favor.$1#$b#What else does he like, besides gridball? There's got to be a way to bribe the man.
SigDialogue610.Fall.1: Gridball season's starting up. I'm honor-bound to root for the Tunnelers, of course. Someday Rosa will come around.
SigDialogue610.Fall.2: The good thing about fall is there's a lot to do outside.#$b#The bad is having to do it, but I guess I'm finally being useful for once.$2
SigDialogue610.Fall.3: Just a head's up, we got like twenty different 'fall' candles. Whole lodge smells like a pumpkin spice factory.$9
SigDialogue610.Fall.4: Yo, @! Did you catch the game last night?$8#$b#Matrick Pahomes is a future hall of famer.$1#$b#In an alternate universe, I'm leading the Tunnelers against him to take the Superb Owl Bowl.$18
SigDialogue610.Fall.5: We had a bonfire last night and... I wonder if that's all I'm good for now, manual labor?$2#$b#%Sig looks very conflicted.$7
SigDialogue610.Winter.1: Gridball season's probably the most universal thing between here and Gotoro.$1#$b#Of course, in Gotoro Ferngillian gridball's a novelty; they have the original gridball which *is* different - the ball's a sphere, for one, and they don't really bother with padding and helmets, either.
SigDialogue610.Winter.2: Slammed the door on accident this morning and probably startled the neighborhood.#$b#Don't worry, I paid for it in the form of the snow sliding off the roof and down the back of my jacket.$9
SigDialogue610.Winter.3: Do you go into the mines a lot this time of year? Is it cold there too or is it insulated kind of?#$b#I don't know if I'll ever wanna be in a cave on purpose, to be honest. Well, in case it's cold, here. Auntie made it.[395 199 236 218]$1
SigDialogue610.Winter.4: %Sig is texting away on his cellphone and you flinch in anticipation when he steps on a patch of ice. To your shock, he just keeps going.#$b#Hm? Hey, @, be careful out today. I shoveled a lot of East Scarp but there's some icy spots I haven't tackled yet.
SigDialogue610.Winter.5: As I'm sure you can predict, local tall man has been put to work hanging every winter decoration that needs to be high up.#$b#Even Evelyn roped me into putting some lights up - Alex just stood around supervising, the {{BearFamProfanityM}}.$18
SigDialogue610T.1: You've been a good friend to me, @.$1#$b#No, that's all. Nothing bad's happening, promise. I'm just trying to appreciate the good things in life more.$18
SigDialogue610T.2: Haley doesn't charge enough for her nature photography but I'm glad she sold some prints to me.$8#$b#I'm sending some stuff to a few folks back in Gotoro, to tell them what kind of place this is.$1#$b#Well, besides my useless descriptions of 'nice' and 'it's like that poem by so-and-so'.$18
SigDialogue610T.3: I used to think the doc was lying about how much maintaining relationships and trying new things would help.#$b#But then I met people like you, and Gus, and Alex. You guys help a lot. You make being a civilian again a lot easier.$4
SigDialogue610T.4: I'm helping Gudrun make flower crowns later today.$1#$b#Well, I'm showing her how to make them. Let us know if you want one, I'm sure you'd look great in daisies.$18
SigDialogue610T.5: Eloise suggested I try a lollipop whenever I'm craving a smoke, and I gotta say, the kid's sharp. It's working better than I thought it would.$11
SigDialogue610T.6: The Valley's really more my speed these days.#$b#I can't say I'll never go home to Zuzu but I've got to stick around in case Gus busts out a new recipe or Penny wants to take a day off from teaching, for now at least.$1
SigDialogue610T.7: Hey, you - *yawn* - sh- sorry. I was up all night trying to bake a cake for Aunt Sondra, but not a single attempt was edible.$2#$b#She woke up right when I was finishing the dishes and made us pancakes instead. She's a real good Auntie.$1
SigDialogue610T.8: Gran asked if I've met anyone special.$8#$b#It's to say someone's name at random just to scandalize her.$1#$b#But she might try to visit the Valley then.#$b#She really puts the bear in Bear and I don't wanna scare the town folks.$10
SigDialogue610T.9: I want to go see a concert. I know, me? Mingling with people, doing things again? Madness.$1#$b#Who's touring right night? Lana Rey Del? Queen Bey? Tailor Swift?$11#$b#I think Teren hates pop music but I bet he'd suck it up for me.$18
SigDialogue610T.10: %Sig is reading a text and smiling.#$b#Oh, hey @. Making plans with Barnes. He lives with here now and I see him daily, so you'd think making plans loses it's charm but...#$b#We lived in each other's back pockets for practically a decade, I can't imagine my life without him.$18
SigDialogue610T.11: I sort of wanna make a donation to the museum so Gunther's forced to buy more interesting books.#$b#I can't do e-reading, makes my head hurt.$2#$b#What kind of books? C'mon, do you really have to ask?$1
SigDialogue610T.12: Harvey thinks I'm making progress.$8#$b#I guess the reports from his therapist friend are reassuring.#$b#I assume it means I'm getting a good grade in therapy, which is definitely how they measure progress, right?$1
SigDialogue610T.13: We're going stargazing tonight, if the sky's clear. There's going to be fresh peaches and iced tea.#$b#So feel free to stop by for an evening with friends.$1
SigDialogue610T.14: Hey you... No, today's not going well at all. Bickered with Gudrun, Gun came back with a big nasty bruise and scared me. Step by step, right?$2
SigDialogue610T.15: You know how I turn my hearing aid off to ignore people?#$b#Jas and Eloise saw me do it while Lewis was droning on about societal standards in small village life.$8#$b#Those little rascals took a whole pink cake in return for their silence.$1
SigDialogue610T.16: %Sig looks sad, but he tries to smile when he spots you.$2#$b#Yeah, don't worry, I took my meds, wrote down my thoughts, drank water... they're just not...$7#$b#Had a rough call with Gran. That old battleaxe.$2
SigDialogue610T.17: You should swing by the Lodge and either talk me into or out of another bad tattoo.#$b#I've been thinking up some truly tacky options - maybe a seahorse with a saddle and a cowboy hat and the words 'just horsing around'.$1#$b#Or a newt dressed as a witch and the words 'I got better'.$18
SigDialogue610T.18: %Sig is carrying a gridball and grinning. He and Alex must have big plans today.#$b#Hey, you! Alex and I roped Shane into playing touch gridball with us.$1#$b#Trying to pick a team name - the Pelican Town Pelicans seems to be the winning choice.$18
SigDialogue610T.19: I'm not really a guy who cares about the meanings behind my ink.#$b#I just like getting tattoos. Makes Gran mad, too, so that's an added bonus.$18#$b#Most of 'em I got in Gotoro, when we'd be stopped at the bigger towns. I used to write to Gudrun when she was still a little thing and have her pick my next tattoo.$1#$b#That'd be the starfish, the jellyfish, and the whale.$18
SigDialogue610T.20: I wound up paying for Jojaflix because there's only so many times I can watch Queen of Sauce reruns.#$b#I don't think 'Jojaflix and chill' is a concept that works here in the Valley though.#$b#Did it work during deployment? Hey, gentlemen don't kiss and tell.$10
SigDialogue610T.21: %Sig is carrying a Zuzu City Times newspaper that has a headline about the war on the front page.#$b#I just barely remembered to save the sudoku for Aunt Sondra. Maybe we should order two copies?$1
SigDialogue610T.22: 'Twist ye, twine ye! even so, mingle shades of joy and woe,'- #$b#Hey, @. Emily shared one of her favorite poems with me... maybe I should teach it to Clint, see if he'd able to win her attention that way?$8#$b#...Nah.$18
SigDialogue610T.23: Gun coerced me into training with Marlon so he could see how someone else would go after the fight.#$b#That old codger's real good. No wonder he runs a guild.$1#$b#Maybe I'll get him next time, if I'm less out of practice.
SigDialogue610T.24: Wound up writing a few poems of my own... No, I'm not gonna share.$11#$b#It feels a little weird though, making time for things like poetry. Maybe I'm more like Uncle Wulf than I realized.$1
SigDialogue610T.25: Got an invite to a military ball.#$b#It's a big thing put on by military spouses to show appreciation for service members and their loved ones.#$b#Mostly, you just get drunk and make fun of the officers, which *is* kinda tempting.$18
SigDialogue610T.26: %Sig yawns loudly and you can see on his face that he hasn't slept much.#$b#Hey @. Stayed up late watching horror movies with Gudrun because she's too scared to watch 'em alone.
SigDialogue610T.27: I'm pretty {{BearFamProfanityD}} helpless at decorating and organizing the house nicely. No, no, sorry - let me rethink that one.$2#$b#The being nice to myself thing is tough.$1#$b#Gudrun's started throwing things at me when I talk down about myself, which has been surprisingly helpful.$18#$b#Please don't also start throwing things at me.$8
SigDialogue610T.28: Hey, @! Auntie's hosting a cooking class for Bears later on, so I'll report back if I don't burn off my eyebrows.$1#$b#In the mean time, have a snack on me; don't worry, I didn't make it.[612 608 243]$1
SigDialogue610T.29: Gun wanted to practice hand to hand combat - which for the record, doesn't bode well for his trips into the mines.$11#$b#He got in a couple of good shots and almost busted my lip open.$1#$b#It was probably karma for all the pranks I pulled on him when we were kids.$10
SigDialogue610T.30: Spoke with Gran for a while on the phone. Even called her Farmor again, like I was a little kid.#$b#If it makes her happy, I guess it's worth it sometimes.$1
SigDialogue610T.31: It's nice to have a pool table at home, but I'm getting more and more comfortable with lingering at the Inn.#$b#Plus Rosa's baking is top-notch.$1#$b#%You realize Sig is hoarding some manner of baked good in his hands that he's clearly not going to share with you. What a jerk.
SigDialogue610T.32: My grandfather grew up here but when he met Gran, she refused to live 'in the wilderness', so he stopped coming to the Valley.#$b#I think he'd still like it out here, if he were still around.$1
SigDialogue610T.33: Had a great conversation with Richie over in Doc Jacob's place.$1#$b#Well, I'm sure Doc Jacob would rather I didn't *encourage* the bird's profanity.$18
SigDialogue610T.34: You should come by for dinner with the family. Unless you're vegan.#$b#Yeah, there's honey in everything, so sue me.$1
SigDialogue610T.35: Do you ever get a sense of nostalgia out of nowhere?#$b#I was grabbing dinner from the Saloon and heard the Prairie King music from the machine, and it was like I was a kid again, begging Uncle Wulf to help me beat the next level.$1
SigDialogue610T.36: Climbed up onto the roof of the Inn because allegedly something got into the chimney.#$b# I'm sure Rosa and Eloise appreciated the comedy act of me and a very fat opossum wrestling on the way back down.$9
SigDialogue610T.37: I still think Gus pities me too much.#$b#{{BearFamProfanityP}} sure seems {{BearFamProfanityC}} on feeding me.$9#$b#The army cooks could care less if you ate. Mind you, his worst cooking beats the best meal or MRE you'd get during deployment
SigDialogue610T.38: 'Does that lamp still burn in my Father's house, which he kindled the night I went away?'-#$b#Oh, sorry, @!$8#$b#Not asking a question, it's just a poem from a book someone finally returned to Gunther.
SigDialogue610T.39: %Sig looks anxious and you can tell he wants to smoke.#$b#Hey @. Getting my prescription refilled today... I know better, but I still worry about what Doc Harvey might think less of me.$2
SigDialogue610T.40: Gudrun inexplicably bet her entire allowance savings on our last game of pool.$8#$b#Of course I gave it back, are you kidding?#$b#Auntie would kill me, for one.$10
SigDialogue610T.41: Finally got off the re-enlistment mailing list. Apparently, I'm a 'liability' in combat zones - but not because of the PTSD.$11#$b#It's because of the hearing loss. Bureaucracy blows, @.$9
SigDialogue610T.42: %Sig has a box of takeout from the Stardrop.#$b#Yeah, I tried to psyche myself up to eat at the Saloon but just couldn't do it.#$b#Said hi to folks while I was there, bought a round of drinks, just enough politeness to disguise my retreat.$1
SigDialogue610T.43: It's not like I can talk to Alex or Gus about the war, but I'm getting better at counting on them to be patient with me when I'm in a bad headspace.#$b#Having friends is... a big deal, actually.$1
SigDialogue610T.44: Got a package from Gotoro. I know, weird, right?#$b#But it's from some civilians we worked with for a bit.#$b#I guess they made it to see the Playwrights' District finally. Sent me some souvenirs. Let me share with you, it's neat stuff.[106 117 126 124]$1
SigDialogue610T.45: You know, I was almost tempted to go into the city today.#$b#Not to see Gran, but just so I could get new boots and maybe some yarn for Emily to knit me a new scarf.#$b#Look, I'm willing to do a lot of things, but there's no way these clumsy hands can knit, @.$1
SigDialogue610T.46: Why is Sebastian that good at pool? It's uncalled for.#$b#Hm? How'd I do? Well, we both won twice and lost twice, but I still don't like it!$1
SigDialogue610T.47: Auntie thinks we oughtta remodel the kitchen.$11#$b#I'm not *opposed* to the labor but she's going to want opinions on every last little bit.$9#$b#I think I've proven time and time again that my tastes in anything is pretty much dismal.
SigDialogue610T.48: %Sig is reading a letter, looking thoughtful.#$b#Hey @. New letter from my parents. I guess the Board of Directors is promoting my dad again.$8#$b#Gunnar looks a lot like him, and subsequently like our gran.#$b#Hm? Oh, I look like my grand-dad... and Uncle Wulf.$2
SigDialogue610T.49: I gotta remember to badger Barnes into making handpies soon.#$b#He used to make 'em when we were camped for awhile, kept those things stashed in my pockets every time I had to stay up waiting for orders from HQ.$1
SigDialogue610T.50: I think I'd be an alright sailor.$11#$b#I mean, I'm not just saying that because of the whole 'Nors' thing - I mean I don't get seasick and I'm pretty sturdy and reliable...$8#$b#Y'think Willy wants a deckhand or two? Me and Gun can make a boy's day of it.$18
SigDialogue610T.51: Gun swiped some of my cologne.#$b#I wouldn't really care but *apparently* slimes like it so he got swarmed at the mines...$11#$b#I know, I know, I shouldn't laugh, but that's what he gets for using my stuff.$18
SigDialogue610T.52: %Sig tries to stifle a yawn while nodding at you.#$b#Hey @. Sorry, I'm a bit worn out. Rough night of sleep after Gun came home bruised all to {{BearFamProfanityA}}.$7#$b#I don't know if he'll ever realize how *exhausting* worrying after him is, but I guess that's just how little brothers are.$7#$b#%Sig tries to say something else but another yawn catches him and he waves you off.
SigDialogue610T.53: %Sig grins when he spots you.#$b#Hey you. I was just thinking about you.$1#$b#Hm? Oh don't worry, nothing bad for once.$18#$b#I joke, I joke, I don't think bad things about you at all, c'mon. You're one in a million, @.$1
SigDialogue610T.54: Y'know, Barnes and I used to play gridball in school together. Well, *different* schools together.#$b#He had a {{BearFamProfanityB}} throwing arm on him, and it only improved after he went through boot camp.$1#$b#He might seem harmless, but he's tough as nails even now. Don't let the pretty boy looks fool you.$18'
SigDialogue610T.55: Barnes is probably my favorite person, but he tends to come across as a soft-hearted guy.#$b#It's why we got along so well back then and still do now.$1#$b#Anytime someone assumes he's easy to fleece, I'm looming behind him like a hired thug.$1#$b#He can absolutely lay me out in a hand-to-hand fight, though.$18
SigDialogue610T.56: I feel like I should enjoy traveling more but it feels like there's a dozen little things to keep track of.#$b#Gudrun says it's because I treat any trip like we're going camping, even if the family books a nice hotel.$8#$b#I mean, I think I'm *adaptable* unlike her and Auntie's four bags and two spare pillows apiece.$18
SigDialogue610T.57: The other day Teren likened me to one of those Great Danes.#$b#Said my height might be handy *now* but when the 'hip dysplasia' kicks in I won't be laughing.$8$#b$Gunnar had the audacity to be the one laughing.$5#$b#So I put both their wallets on top of the fridge. Now who's laughing?$18
SigDialogue610T.58: I wonder how hard it would be to put poetry to any of Uncle Wulf's compositions? I guess that's a question for like, Auntie, or Sam, huh?$8
SigDialogue610T.59: Gudrun's got such an interesting vernacular sometimes.$8#$b#Kid's out there using lawyer-talk and thesis language then hits you with a 'like totally' outta nowhere.$18#$b#I dunno where she gets it from - as far as I've seen she doesn't have a lot of school friends.#$b#Maybe she's just watching too much TV - but if I say that I sound practically prehistoric, huh?$9
SigDialogue610T.60: %When you get close to Sig, you see he has a giant bandage on his neck.#$b#Rest assured, I wasn't mauled by some wild critter. Gun had the bright idea of teaching Gudrun how to swing a sword and she managed to clobber me in the first five minutes.#$b#Hah? It was a fully dulled wooden blade - I'm not letting that crazy kid around anything sharper than a two by four.$18
SigDialogue610T.Spring.1: I don't know about Flower Dances, but I do know bees dance, which is more than I can say for myself.#$b#Maybe I should be a bee in my next life.$1
SigDialogue610T.Spring.2: Hey, you. I'm branching out in the honey business. Try this, I know it's nerve-wracking to try food or drinks I make, but even Gus liked it.$1[(O)MadDog.HashtagBearFam_FerskenPeach_Mead]
SigDialogue610T.Spring.3: Robin and I are going out a ways to plant some trees, apparently.#$b#Well, I'm digging the holes for the saplings while Robin bosses me around. Thrilling stuff, reforestation.$11
SigDialogue610T.Spring.4: Alex and I are co-hosting a gym class.#$b#Technically, it's for children, but if you wanna learn how to climb a rope or throw a perfect pass, come hang out.
SigDialogue610T.Spring.5: Peaches! That's what this weather's good for, fresh peaches. Got any? Here, have one.[MadDog.HashtagBearfam.FerskenPeach]$1#$b#Why do we have a peach tree? Y'know, that was put there *way* before my grandfather was even born. Maybe Bears have always liked peaches?#$b#They're definitely my favorite.$1
SigDialogue610T.Summer.1: Yeah I know, I know. I keep complaining about the heat. Gun tried to use me as shade earlier.$11#$b#What? You think that's a good idea? I'm not that *tall*! C'mon now.$1
SigDialogue610T.Summer.2: I haven't been sunburned in forever, this sucks.$5#$b#Gun slapped me on the back at breakfast and I made a sound like a dying guinea pig *and* elbowed my glass of milk off the table.#$b#Get in some shade today, I'm all but begging you, @.$8
SigDialogue610T.Summer.3: %Sig's jeans are soaked and he looks sheepish.#$b#Got lost in my thoughts and tripped over a half-buried piece of driftwood into one of the tide pools.$8#$b#Gudrun called me a detriment to the ecosystem.$2#$b#She made me apologize to the ocean.$9
SigDialogue610T.Summer.4: Gun's a late sleeper when it's warm.#$b#My body still thinks I'm in the military, so sleeping in isn't even a choice.$11#$b#I don't know if being an early-riser helps much unless you're a {{LPJobTitle}} or maybe a doctor, like Harvey or Jacob...
SigDialogue610T.Summer.5: If it weren't for the bees, I'd be at the beach a lot.#$b#Shirtless, because really, why not? Gotta enjoy my body while I'm still in shape, right?$10
SigDialogue610T.Fall.1: Gudrun texted me to declare the pumpkins in the city are sub-par compared to the ones here.#$b#Breaking news, I know. We'll be by to buy a few from you soon, I'm sure.$1
SigDialogue610T.Fall.2: I don't know if I believe in superstitions - black cats? They're cute.#$b#Jack-o-lanterns? Messy, but pumpkin seeds are {{BearFamProfanityD}} tasty. Maybe I'm just not an easily spooked guy?$8#$b#...If I find you outside the Lodge wearing a bedsheet with two holes cut for eyes I'm throwing you in a pile of leaves, @.$18
SigDialogue610T.Fall.3: Last night's game was an absolute disgrace to the sport of gridball.$5#$b#I'm going to go back in time and accept the scholarship just so I can fix this travesty in the world of professional sports.
SigDialogue610T.Fall.4: 'In Possum Land the nights are fair, the streams are fresh and clear,'-$1#$b#You could absolutely write Possum Land about the Valley. Maybe update it to Junimo Land.$10
SigDialogue610T.Fall.5: Hey you. Gudrun roped me into helping her design info-graphs for her social media campaign.#$b#Totally made her cringe when I asked if it was for the 'gram'.$10
SigDialogue610T.Winter.1: ...'The only other sound's the sweep - of easy wind and downy flake' - oh, @, you startled me.#$b#Yeah, Robert Lee Frost. Seasonally appropriate in both poem and poet, right?$1
SigDialogue610T.Winter.2: Went around shoveling the main pathways mostly for my own benefit. But Aideen gave me a crocus to say thanks.$1#$b#I didn't know what to do with it so I wound up giving it Jas who gave it Penny. That flower's better traveled then most people around here.
SigDialogue610T.Winter.3: Got the tar beat out of me in a snowball fight with Alex. It's nice to have someone to horse around with, even if I did lose.#$b#And Haley enjoyed the show, too.$10
SigDialogue610T.Winter.4: It's stupid cold outside; I think I'll stick indoors and waste the day on video games.#$b#But what should I play? Maybe President Weevil 8 with the big mosquito lady? She is very tall and pretty after all.$10
SigDialogue610T.Winter.5: Gridball's actually a lot more fun in the snow. For one, when Alex tackles me, I don't end up with a thousand bruises.$1#$b#I do end up with snow down my shirt, which I'm not exactly thrilled by, but beggars can't be choosers.
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.1: You really special to me, @.$1#$b#No, sorry, I don't have anything witty or dramatic to add to that. I just wanted you to know that you mean a lot to me.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.2: Haley doesn't charge enough for her nature photography but I'm glad she sold some to me.$8#$b#I'm sending a care package back to some friends in Gotoro.$1#$b#We could send some photos of us, too, if you wanted.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.3: 'A man had given all other bliss, and all his worldly worth for this. To waste his whole heart in one kiss'-$1#$b#Maybe he kissed you? That would certainly be worth my whole heart.$4#$b#%Sig presses a kiss to the back of your hand, winking at you.
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.4: My grandmother asked if I've met anyone special.$8#$b#I mean, I have but I would never inflict Gran on you. She really puts the bear in Bear and I don't wanna scare you off.$10
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.5: What's up, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}? Officially done with your exhausting manual labor for the day and you're finally free to throw yourself into my arms?$1#$b#I give great bear hugs.#$b#It's in the name, after all.$10
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.6: We should get matching tattoos.#$b#Not our names, I'm tacky but I'm not *that* tacky!$8#$b#Just something that belongs together. Like we do.$4#$b#And I swear, they can be as tasteful as you want, @.$18
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.7: I'm slowly but surely becoming more and more like my Uncle Wulf. I met my muse - that's you - and now I have inspiration never-ending.$4#$b#It *does* mean I've written an excess of cheesy love poems, but it's been nice, being secure enough to express these feelings about you.$1
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.8: Sometimes I wonder if I had the chance to go back in time and make different choices, what would happen.$8#$b#Don't worry, I'd remember to move to the Valley so we could still meet and fall in love no matter what other choices I made.$4#$b#What can I say, you make a guy wanna ruin the space-time continuum.$10
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.9: Hey, you. I got to thinking - I know, dangerous, but hear my proposal out - we need to spend more time together.#$b#Tell me to do yardwork or something for you. Or better yet, come over to the Lodge and play video games with me.$1#$b#I'll even let you win.$10
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.10: It's not that I don't want to talk to you about my time in Gotoro, I just don't want to bog you down with the tragedy at the end.#$b#I appreciate you being patient with me when I get into a bad headspace. You're a light in my darkness, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.11: I really want to be able to give you all the best things in life, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$4#$b#I'd take you on a tour of the entire globe, bring you amazing wonders from every continent...$1#$b#Hm? Well, what's the point of having a rich partner if he doesn't spoil you every once in awhile?$10[108 72 578]
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.12: Look at us, @, we're alive, and there are experiences to have and love to share and at the end of the day we can fall asleep and do it all over again.$1#$b#Aren't we so very lucky? Well, I feel very lucky, around you.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.13: I really don't like talking to people, or being around people, or any of all that.#$b#%Sig pauses for a few moments, looking pensive before smiling at you.#$b#But I like talking to you and being around you, so please let me linger at your side for as long as you can stand me.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.14: I wander around all day, just thinking how great it is to live in the universe you love me in.$4#$b#It's probably a little thing in the grand scheme of it all; grains of sand to someone else, but the whole {{BearFamProfanityD}} coastline for me.$18
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.15: You should just stay over late one of these nights and binge watch Beware the Mothman with me.#$b#Aw, c'mon, it's not *that* scary and besides, I'll hold you if you do get frightened.$4#$b#We've got blankets big enough for two of me to hide you in, too, in case you doubt my ability to keep you safe.$10
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.16: I don't need anything else in life with you at my side, hand in hand with me.#$b#But we don't gotta hold hands in case you're trying to preserve your reputation as the local cool.$10#$b#I'd never infringe upon your legend like that.#$b#%Sig says that but his fingers twitch as though they're ready to be intertwined with yours. He's not fooling anyone.
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.17: %Sig pulls you gently into his arms, hugging you firmly but not so hard that you feel trapped.#$b#...You looked like you could've used one of those so it was my job to deliver.$10#$b#These Bear hugs are bespoke just for you, you know and they're made on demand, so anytime you need one... I'm your man.$18
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.18: I like the way your hand fits with mine, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. I like the way you fit into my life... and I hope you like the way I fit into yours.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.19: You're the best thing I've got going for me.#$b#I trust you with parts of me I'd show no one else on this planet.$4#$b#I'd like to think I'm able to return the gesture, and be the safe space for your secrets, too.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.20: You know how much I like you, right? I wanna be the one who finds your keys when you misplace them and makes your favorite drink exactly how you like it.$1#$b#I want your laugh ringing in my ears and your silences to be comfortable next to mine.$18#$b#...Just, I like you a lot, @. {{BearFamProfanityD}} near as much as I love you.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.21: I like being around you. In case I haven't said that enough lately.#$b#I like seeing you happy and I like seeing you at all... I like your face. It's my favorite.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.22: I love you.$4#$b#I don't tell you I love you just so I can hear you say it back... I say it because I wanna make sure you know.$18
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.23: Hah? Oh, that's nice. Oughtta do that more often...$18#$b#%Sig seems needlessly pleased with himself.#$b#Hm? Oh, you're the first thing I've heard today. Real nice. Kinda makes me wanna keep my hearing aid off until I see you for the day.$4
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.24: You can call me whatever you want to, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, as long as it 'yours'.$4#$b#Yeah, yeah, that means you could even call me 'your Siggy'. Don't go tellin' ol' 'Pam I gave you special permission though.$18
SigDialogue810R.Chaste.25: You're real cute today, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, with just every little thing you do. Oughtta bottle you up and keep you in a safe place so everyone else can learn how it's done.$18#$b#But that actually makes me sound deranged, so instead I'll uh, stick to bragging 'bout how great my @ is to anyone who mentions you in passing.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.1: Gun coaxed me into another hand-to-hand combat practice.$11#$b#First off, he REALLY shouldn't be fist-fighting slimes, right? Or duggies. That's a guaranteed disadvantage.$9#$b#Second, he hit me in the face hard enough to make my jaw pop.$8%Sig pouts at you dramatically.#$b#Why yes, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, a kiss would make me feel better. Actually, better make it three or four - can't be too careful.$18
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.2: Sucked it up enough to linger at the Saloon last Friday and play a round with Sebastian and Sam.$1#$b#Sam lost a day's wages to me, and I lost triple that to Sebastian.$9#$b#But if *you* would like to play against me, you're welcome to wager a kiss... or whatever else you might desire, instead of cash.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.3: I gotta stop playing pool against Sebastian. I mean, yeah I won twice but I also lost twice afterwards.$8#$b#Wait, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, I *did* win twice, so that's worth at least two kisses. C'mere.$10$#$b#Sig cups your face gently and kisses you twice without caring who might see, smirking afterwards.
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.4: %When Sig spots you, he picks you up in a hug and presses several obnoxiously loud kisses to your face before setting you back down gently.#$b#Hah? Why? Just because. Sometimes you've gotta give yourself what your heart really wants, right?$4#$b#And per usual, my heart wants you.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.5: Y'know, if you ever find yourself in need of help at %farm, I am *fantastic* at taking orders. Used t' do it for a living, after all.$18#$b#Actually, if it's you giving 'em, you can pretty much just order me around anytime anywhere you want for any reason, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. I am very obedient for the right touch.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.6: %Sig looks at you like he's undressing you with his eyes. When he realizes he's been caught, he winks at you like the rough and tumble scoundrel that he thinks he is.#$b#You look like you could use a break, @. Come over to mine, my bed's soft enough for two and my door locks.$18
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.7: Y'know, if you ever get tired and need to rest, might I suggest sitting in my lap?$10#$b#%Sig slaps one of his thighs loudly.#$b#These bad boys can hold so much @, it's crazy.#$b#Not to mention me being packed - with multiple features, is of course what I meant.$18
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.8: Hm? Were you biting your lip just now? ...Wanna c'mere and bite mine?$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.9: I wanna watch the stars with you one of these clear nights... or make you see stars. Honestly, I'm down to make both happen if you are.$18
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.10: If all the stupid things that come out of my mouth aren't enough to prove the depth of my feelings for you, maybe my actions can speak louder.#$b#%Sig wraps his arms around you and lifts you off the ground, smirking widely.#$b#Your place or mine, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}? Clock's a-tickin'.$18#$b#%He sets you back down with a well-meaning leer, letting you choose your own fate. He's not really as big and bad as he thinks he is, after all.
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.11: Y'know, Robin's had me running all over half the {{BearFamProfanityD}} mountain today, and Auntie sent me back to the store four different times, so I really feel like a mess.$9#$b#And to think, you had no part in it! That's a real travesty, don'tcha think? If you've got spare time later, come make a proper mess of me.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.12: I'd make a joke about being a hungry bear about to eat up a poor defenseless {{LPJobTitle}}, but I think by law you'd have to hit me with your hoe for a line that cheesy...#$b#Of course... you do look good enough to eat and I'm pretty much always hungry, so maybe leave the door unlocked at %farm and we can *both* have our fill.$18
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.13: Wanna trade kisses, @? I like yours better'n mine.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.14: Hah? ...Oh, @.#$b#%Sig reaches out and plucks a twig off of you.#$b#Hmmm. Your top's still a bit dirty though, isn't it? Such a shame. You should take it off. I can help with that.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.15: We should go skulk at the Saloon together one of these nights, play some pool.$1#$b#Actually, Gus gave me a spare key to the joint awhile back, we could go after everyone clears out... maybe make some friendly wagers versus each other... and hey, they don't *have* to be strictly friendly, right?$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.16: Got some spare time today, @? Want to find out what we can get away with before someone comes looking for us?$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.17: Hmm, perfect timing @. I'm cold, come hold my hands.$18#$b#%Sig stares at you expectantly, wiggling his fingers hopefully. This is probably a trap, but you decide to go with the flow. As soon as you do, he moves both your hands behind your back.#$b#...Well, looks like I caught myself a {{LPJobTitle}}. Now what to do with you?$10#$b#%Whatever Sig's plans for you are, he's going to make sure your wishes and you come first.
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.18: Hey, and here I was daydreaming about kissing you, and you've magically appeared before me.$18#$b#%Sig leans in for a deep kiss.#$b#Well, I guess I know what I need to daydream about tonight, since this worked out so well for me.$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.19: You should come read with me. I promise, I'll be on my best behavior, keep my hands to m'self.$18#$b#...Of course, the easiest way for us to the read the *same* book is for you to sit in my lap, so I can read over your shoulder... and if you're sitting on my lap, I may well wrap you up in my arms, right?$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.20: %Sig kisses you, chaste and brief, not at all like his usual 'we should go make out and more' smooches.#$b#...Oh? Did I leave you wanting more?$18#$b#Well far be it from me not to deliver.$10#$b#%That didn't last long. Sig seals his mouth overs you and doesn't stop until you both need oxygen again.
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.21: %Sig wraps his arms around you, burying his face against your hair and taking a deep breath.#$b#...Almost got you memorized, @, but there's a few more things I wanna touch and taste before I can claim I confidently know you by heart.$18#$b#Come home to me tonight so I can work on memorizing more of you?$10
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.22: Hah? Hey, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. You know, thoughts of you kept me up all night. 'You are a world of unknowns, with your skin a map, my mouth traces your lines, a commitment to the roads, of your palm your neck your heart -'...$18#$b#%Maybe Sig should recite poetry to you more often so it can keep you up at night instead.
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.23: %Sig catches your hand in his own, intertwining your fingers together. He gazes into your eyes for a long, soft moment, clearly enamored with you, before pulling you closer and kissing you deeply.
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.24: Can I kiss you? I promise *this* time, I for sure won't get carried away. I'm the big one, after all, I'm too heavy to carry.$18#$b#%Sig makes as if he's going to heave you over his shoulder but switches up his antics at the last minute to sweetly kiss you instead.
SigDialogue810R.Spicy.25: I always worry I'm too much for you. Too mean, too much tragic backstory... too big.#$b#%Sig will be unbearably smug if you agree to that last point. But if you deny it, he'll just whisk you away to prove it. Sometimes, there's no winning with this Bear.
patio.Sigurd.Spicy.1: %Sig lights up when he sees you and pulls you into an embrace, dipping you backwards and kissing you slowly, his hands settled dangerously low on your body for being outside where anyone can see you.#$b#Just what I needed.$4
patio.Sigurd.Spicy.2: You know, now that I think about it, breakfast wasn't quite enough - let's head back inside so we both can have seconds... or thirds... I mean, who can blame me when you look good enough to eat?$18
patio.Sigurd.Spicy.3: Hey you. Need some plowing done, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}?$18#$b#'Course I meant the fields, what else could I have possibly meant? I'd *never* be so untoward towards you.$10
spouseroom.Sigurd.Spicy.1: You know, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, that couch is big enough for both us, if we get creative with our close proximity arrangements.$18#$b#Whaddya say, wanna spend all day learning some new positions with me?$10
spouseroom.Sigurd.Spicy.2: %Sig has a pensive look on his face.#$b#The rabbit ears have gotten more bent... I just can't seem to recall what I tossed at 'em, your shirt or mine?$18
spouseroom.Sigurd.Spicy.3: I was thinking, I should read out loud to you one these days... Let's see...$18#$b#We've got a book about {{SigurdRisqueBookDescriptor}}. How 'bout it, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}?$10
spring.Married.Sigurd.Spicy: Alright, @, we're starting strong today - here's something for breakfast, and -$4#$b#%Sig scoops you up off the floor and spins you around twice before setting you down and kissing you.#$b#And that's just for the {{BearFamProfanityA}} of it.$10[201]
summer.Married.Sigurd.Spicy: Look, I'll be shirtless as much as you want me to be all season long because I love you and want you to get you everything you want.$18#$b#But if any my tattoos start fading, you're holding my hand the entire time I get them touched up.$1#$b#You're not gonna weasel out of it, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, I *need* the support.$10
fall.Married.Sigurd.Spicy: Fall's a great time of year. Weather's juuuust right.$1#$b#And, of course, my birthday's coming up, and you have that fun little red outfit I like taking off with my teeth...$18
winter.Married.Sigurd.Spicy: Winter's sprung, and so am I. You're all bundled up like a present - let me unwrap you, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$18
RainyDay.Sigurd.Spicy.0: Here, Gus saw the forecast and sent me home with this to keep us warm. And then later, we can keep each other warm all night long.$4[236]
RainyDay.Sigurd.Spicy.1: Here, let's start off with some warm tea and maybe then our morning routine can get further derailed with some other, more vigorous warming activities.$10[614]
RainyDay.Sigurd.Spicy.2: %Sig pulls you into a deep kiss, boxing you up in his arms and not loosening his hold until long after you both have forgotten that it was raining.#$b#...Are you sure you gotta leave the house, {{}}? We've got plenty a'time to keep this going...$18
RainyDay.Sigurd.Spicy.3: I bet if we put ourselves together, we can both be louder than this rain storm... C'mon @, let me carry you back to bed and make you moan.$18
RainyNight.Sigurd.Spicy.0: 'If two lie down together, they will keep warm; But how can one be warm alone?'#$b#Hey, @, come and keep warm with me. Bet I won't even need to use my hands.$10
RainyNight.Sigurd.Spicy.1: %Sig immediately pulls you into his arms and kisses you.#$b#Sorry, you're soaked from the rain and I just couldn't resist.$4#$b#Go get changed and I'll heat something for dinner to warm you up.#$b#Naw, it won't be my terrible cooking, I promise.$10
RainyNight.Sigurd.Spicy.2: 'Till memory gleams with golden dreams, of love and song and wine'.$1#$b#I've got the wine and the love to spare, if you'd like to come make a song with me, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$4
RainyNight.Sigurd.Spicy.3: C'mere. I just, I just need a distraction so I can sleep better.$4#$b#%Sig takes both your hands in his own and pulls you close.#$b#You're the best distraction around, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, rain or shine.$10#$b#%Sig leans down and kisses you, clearly intent on being distracted for awhile.
IndoorDay.Sigurd.Spicy.0: One of these days, I'll get my timing perfect so that I'll be all shirtless and freshly washed just in time to tempt you into ravishing me all day.$10#$b#%Sig tucks his face against your neck to instead do some ravishing of his own.
IndoorDay.Sigurd.Spicy.1: Is there anything worth pursuing outside? Doubt it. Guess I'll just have to chase you around until I can get you underneath me, huh?$10#$b#Best start runnin', {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$18
IndoorDay.Sigurd.Spicy.2: You know, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, the couch folds out and I'm a big fan of mixing things up, trying new places out - how about you follow me to the couch and have your wicked way with me?$18
IndoorDay.Sigurd.Spicy.3: %Sig ensnares you into his arms, running his teeth over your neck teasingly.#$b#Clear your schedule, today you're mine, and you're going to have your hands full - at least to start with.$18
IndoorNight.Sigurd.Spicy.0: %Sig kisses you, he tastes overwhelmingly like spearmint gum.#$b#Went through four packs of gum but I managed to not smoke once today.$1#$b#Of course, now that you're home, the only craving I have is you.$10
IndoorNight.Sigurd.Spicy.1: %Sig smiles at you, reciting a new poem.$1#$b#'Teach me how to not want you like I do, the taste of your skin my salvation, the beating of my heart for you alone.'$4#$b#Missed you all day, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.
IndoorNight.Sigurd.Spicy.2: C'mere.#$b#%Sig cups your face and peppers kisses all over your cheeks and forehead.#$b#Alright, you're free to go. Hmm? Oh what was that?$1#$b#Bear repellent. Should keep everything besides your specific Bear off you.$10#$b#Now get going before I change my mind and take you back inside.$10
IndoorNight.Sigurd.Spicy.3: %Sig gazes at you heatedly, reaching out to trace your collarbones.#$b#...Let's get you out of those clothes, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, and directly into my bed where you belong. I think we're in for a long, long night.$18
Outdoor.Sigurd.Spicy.0: Arguably, the weather's nice and I'm in love with you, so we could skip all the errands and go laze about in the fields.$1#$b#Even do more than laze about, if you're up for the excitement of hoping nobody comes 'round to %farm while my head's between your thighs.$18
Outdoor.Sigurd.Spicy.1: Hear me out, skip work - wait, wait, listen. Skip work.$1#$b#Come with me to the beach. I'll find you all the best seashells, I will look respectfully at you in your swimsuit until you tell me to do otherwise.$10#$b#%Sig leers for good measure. He's going to try to get you to skinny dip with him.
Outdoor.Sigurd.Spicy.2: So, theory. If I were to stay out here topless - or more - waiting for you, would that hurry you home or -? I'm just trying to figure out how to get you to come to me faster.$18
Outdoor.Sigurd.Spicy.3: What a view...#$b#%Sig is staring directly at you.#$b#Hey, gorgeous, come here often? Would you like to start?$10#$b#I can definitely help with that.$18
Good.Sigurd.Spicy.0: %Sig cups your face in both of his hands, gazing into your eyes for a long moment. With a bashful grin, he leans down for a deep kiss.$1#$b#Love ya, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$4
Good.Sigurd.Spicy.1: %Sig wraps his arms around you and lifts you into the air effortlessly, spinning you several times before setting you down gently and kissing you passionately.#$b#Feel that, the woosh in your chest from something unexpected? That's how you make me feel daily.$1
Good.Sigurd.Spicy.2: %Sig rubs your shoulders, his touch firm yet gentle and soothing.$1#$b#If you think I'm good with my hands, you should stay home and see what I can do with my mouth.$10
Good.Sigurd.Spicy.3: %Sig scoops you up and scatters kisses all over your face before putting you back down lightly.#$b#Sorry, you just weren't prepared enough to ward off a bear attack.$10
Good.Sigurd.Spicy.4: %Sig looks like he'd really love to be his knees for you right now.#$b#{{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}? Got some time to spare? Let me make it worth your while.$18
OneKid.Sigurd.0: What? Nooo, I didn't tell %kid1 to whisper 'I'm a piece of cheese' over and over in the kitchen to catch a mouse so I could get the laundry done.$10#$b#I would never use the pure innocence of a child against them like that.$18
OneKid.Sigurd.1: %kid1 looks so much like you when they pout. I can't say no to that adorable face.$1#$b#Yeah, yeah, ask away, I'll give you whatever you want, too.$10
OneKid.Sigurd.2: %kid1 pulled the pillowcase off their pillow and put it over their head.#$b#Yeah, yeah, I rescued 'em. They started crying because 'there's something wrong with these pants'.#$b#What kind of child have we created, @?$8
OneKid.Sigurd.3: You are the most wonderful person in the world. You're brilliant, strong, witty, attractive -#$b#I got chewing gum in %kid1's hair. Don't ask, please just help, I'm a whole new level of 'incompetent dad'.$8
OneKid.Sigurd.4: Alex asked what I changed in my workout routine to get so buff.#$b#Bench-pressing %kid1 while they make jet engine noises has been great for my gains, let me tell you.$10
TwoKids.Sigurd.0: %Sig's tattoo sleeve is randomly colored in. The colors go outside of the lines and are generally messy.#$b#Hey, guess what happens if you fall asleep around a pair of children armed with markers? I hope it doesn't wash off for a while.$1
TwoKids.Sigurd.1: Oh, @, we're so glad to see you.#$b#%kid1 told %kid2 that they could catch a squirrel if they stood on our porch and said 'I'm a nut'.#$b#I'm pretty sure Marnie heard our beautiful child *shout* 'I'm a nut' at the top of their little lungs.#$b#No, I didn't pull this prank on Gun when we were kids.$1#$b#Totally not an older sibling rite of passage.$1
TwoKids.Sigurd.2: Thank you. Just - you, %kid1, %kid2 - I was so scared I'd never have this.$4#$b#I *wouldn't* have this without you. You guys are my light in the darkness. Thank you, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$1
TwoKids.Sigurd.3: Gran wants to update her will to include %kid1 and %kid2 'in case something happens to the pair of you'.#$b#Real gruesome of her, right? But... I guess even she still cares in her own way.$18
TwoKids.Sigurd.4: %Sig is thoroughly covered head to toe in mud.#$b#Hey, so - the kids are washed. %kid1 took up the noble task of digging up every single worm in a ten foot radius of the porch and upon learning what was happening %kid2 had a meltdown because the 'worms are now homeless'.$9#$b#I managed to talk down %kid1 from the 'worm hostage crisis' and now they're safely buried again.#$b#%kid2 has since crowned me sheriff of Wormtown.$9#$b#Stop laughing.$1
Neutral.Sigurd.0: If there's something you need from me that I'm not picking up on hints about, just say the word, @. I'm your man through and through, after all. Gotta show up my best for you.
Neutral.Sigurd.1: Make sure you take time for yourself, @. You seem more withdrawn and as someone who pulls away myself, I know it's easy to work through it than actually take time to get well... And I'm here for you through whatever it is.
Neutral.Sigurd.2: %Sig watches you intently, concern etched in the lines at the corners of his eyes.
Neutral.Sigurd.3: I love you, @. I hope my love can go with you to all your errands and chores when I'm not available.
Neutral.Sigurd.4: Schedule yourself some breaks or else *you'll* break, @. And if I have to keep you in my lap while we go mindless watching Jojaflix to get a break kick-started, I will, believe it.
Neutral.Sigurd.5: Don't forget to lean on me. I'm built like a brick house, you can lean all over me for as long as you need, @.
Neutral.Sigurd.6: Hey, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. You got some time to spare soon? I was thinking we needed a little more us time. Make sure we're still good time. Y'know.
Neutral.Sigurd.7: Aw, {{BearFamProfanityA}}, I'm forgetting something, {{BearFamProfanityD}} it. What is it, that's the million gold question... Maybe I need a smoke, clear my head. You doing good, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}?
Neutral.Sigurd.8: I feel like I forgot something... hm, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}} did you ask me to do something that I forgot? I'm sorry I have to ask but I'd rather ask and do it then forget it and shove it off onto your plate.
Bad.Sigurd.0: Hey, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. I'm just - I'm sorry for not helping out more, I know you didn't sign up for this.$7#$b#%He smells strongly of cigarette smoke. He was outside all night.
Bad.Sigurd.1: I know I woke you up last night, I - I can sleep on the floor for a bit until I get better.$7#$b#%He smells strongly of cigarette smoke. He spent most of the night outside.
Bad.Sigurd.2: %Sig is looking at his list of names, his hands trembling. He smells like he's been chainsmoking all night.$7
Bad.Sigurd.3: Good morning, @. Just let me know if I'm being too mean lately; I'm trying to temper myself but I know I can be rough around the edges.$7#$b#%He smells strongly of cigarette smoke. He stayed out in the fields last night til the sun came up.
Bad.Sigurd.4: I don't remember if I took my meds.$8#$b#Ah, I'll try to keep to myself today. I love you, @, I just can't process very much right now.$7#$b#%He smells strongly of cigarette smoke. He looks like he hasn't been sleeping well beside you.
Bad.Sigurd.5: %Sig turns off his hearing aid when you go to speak to him; he's clearly not going to try today.
Bad.Sigurd.6: %Sig rubs at the bridge of his nose, sighing deeply.$9#$b#What did I do wrong this time?$7#$b#%He smells strongly of cigarette smoke.
Bad.Sigurd.7: Please, stop needling me like this.$5#$b#I'm trying my best, okay, please just meet me half way.$7#$b#%He smells strongly of cigarette smoke.
Bad.Sigurd.8: %Sig glances at you briefly before grabbing his cigarette pack out of his pocket, counting them out before eying the door.
patio.Sigurd.Chaste.1: Hey you. Just checking on the hives, making sure they're humming along.$1
patio.Sigurd.Chaste.2: %Sig is reciting poetry. You're not sure if it's for practice or for his bees.
patio.Sigurd.Chaste.3: Think I could expand next Spring, get some more honey bees?#$b#Well, I've got the sweetest thing of all already - you.$1
spouseroom.Sigurd.Chaste.1: You know if you ever get tired of playing the same ol' games, holler at me. I'm your Bear, @, I can provide for you, no matter the circumstances.$4
spouseroom.Sigurd.Chaste.2: I've been thinking, maybe we could have our own little book club...#$b#Honestly, I'm just making up an excuse to hear your voice more - you could read me the Valley phone book and I'd still be charmed, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$18
spouseroom.Sigurd.Chaste.3: There's a lot more dead poets than living ones out there, but even by narrowing it down like that, I don't know if I could choose a favorite.$1#$b#Stick around, let me read you poetry and feed you grapes.[398]
funLeave.Married.Sigurd.1: No matter where I wind up for the day, you're my true north and my heart's always going to be pointing me straight back to you.$18#$b#And I'll pick up some groceries while I'm out, I've got the list this time right here.$10
funLeave.Married.Sigurd.2: I made an checkup appointment for %pet so we'll run over to Dr. Jacob's later on while you're out and about.
funLeave.Married.Sigurd.3: I'm swinging up to the Lodge later so I can help Gudrun clean her room. Yeah, it's a pit. That's kid sisters for you.$1
funReturn.Married.Sigurd.1: I think I pulled something playing gridball with Alex and Teren. Am I getting old, you think?$8#$b#Here though, I bought extra just in case it could help you out, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$1#[351]
funReturn.Married.Sigurd.2: Stopped by the Saloon on my way home and I swear Gus was flirting with Auntie. Do you think I should give him a stern talking to?$10
funReturn.Married.Sigurd.3: Gunther spent a good part of the time laughing at me.#$b#My {{SigurdClassSubjectDescriptor}} student {{SigurdTeachingExperience}} at today's virtual session... and then {{SigurdSchoolDay}}.$11#$e#After that? You are a sight for sore eyes, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$1
spring.Married.Sigurd.Chaste: Hear that, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}? That's the sound of the world finally thawing and getting back to rights. Thanks for seeing the winter through with me... I love you.$4
spring.Married.Sigurd.19: Hey {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, it's Auntie's birthday today. I'm headed up to the Lodge to celebrate with her and those awful siblings of mine.$1#$b#How old is she turning? Why, fifty of course. Again.$10
spring.Married.Sigurd.28: Hm? Barnes Day? Again? Awful, no good. Reckon I should give him attention lest he break down our door later, huh?$10
summer.Married.Sigurd.Chaste: Remember to stay hydrated, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. If I have to stalk you around %farm and pass you water bottles, I will, but you're going stay glowy and dewy and healthy ALL summer, so help me Yoba.$18
summer.Married.Sigurd.11: Have fun at the potluck for me.#$b#You don't have to bring anything back, just go relax and enjoy yourself, you've more than earned a little celebration, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$1
fall.Married.Sigurd.Chaste: So this is the most important time of the year here at %farm, right?#$b#%Sig pantomimes rolling up his sleeves.#$b#Put me to work, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, I won't let you or %farm down.$1
