StringsTerenSigurdStoryD4: It was *{{BearFamProfanityD}}* good cheesecake. Totally worth bugging the mayor and her missus for.#$b#So yeah, I think I'd stop at Marta's first. Do a few chores for her and Jess and reminisce over cheesecake and coffee. Sure do miss those two.$1
StringsTerenGreenRain1: Even my record player? How's that possible?!$9
StringsTerenGreenRain2: I guess at least I'm not marching in this junk again.$7
StringsTerenGreenRain3: Hi @! I'm incredibly bored. Used up some PTO thanks to this rain, too.
StringsTerenDTZA1: I think it'd be nice to get a group together to come into the city but planning things as an adult is nigh impossible.$1#$b#Well, I can always imagine the fun, right?
StringsTerenDTZA2: Hm... I hate when I'm given a selection to order from, I want to try all the beer.#$b#There should be little beer samplers for indecisive people like me.$1
StringsTerenDTZA3: Of course Big Bear is scowling hard enough to split the dance.$2#$b#Hey, Big Bear, lighten up, you big gruesome dork.$1
StringsTerenDTZB1: Bleh, I didn't like my last drink so I foisted it off on Big Bear.#$b#He'll pretty much drink anything, luckily for me.$3
StringsTerenDTZB2: Oh, I like this song. I mean, I think I like every song, but I really like this one.$1#$b#%Teren is swaying side to side like he wants to dance.
StringsTerenDTZB3: Aww, Big Bear, dance with me!$3#$b#%Teren is pouting and tugging on Sig's arm very determinedly, but Sig remains unfazed by his antics.
StringsMarriedTerenDesertFestival1: There's my marvelous desert blossom~$1#$b#Are you enjoying yourself, {{LPTerenSpouseNameA}}?$8
StringsMarriedTerenDesertFestival2: Oh, we should go order from the food booth together - we can each pick an ingredient!$1#$b#...Er, you wouldn't pick the hot sauce, right, {{LPTerenSpouseNameA}}?
StringsMarriedTerenDesertFestival3: Looking just a little red right now, {{LPTerenSpouseNameA}}. Harvey's stocked up on sun screen - if need be, we can head over that way and get us both SPF-protected.
StringsTerenDesertFestival1: Big Bear bought himself a mummy mask and I'm afraid of what he's scheming.$7
StringsTerenDesertFestival2: Did you get a free cactus? Mine's kind of got an uncanny face, I'm a little afraid of it. I'm going to make it face the wall when I go to sleep.$7
StringsTerenDesertFestival3: Calico's a good name for a desert, but I was hoping for WAY more cats.
StringsTerenDesertFestival4: Y'know, I'm sure there is some desert areas in the Gotoro Empire but I am *so* relieved we never had to march through them... It's not the heat that will get you, for the record - it's the slipping and rolling down a sand dune while your best friend laughs at you.#$b#%Teren's surely talking about Sig.
StringsTerenDesertFestival5: Ol' Marlon sure has a convincing pitch about trying my best in the Skull Caverns... but admittedly the 'Caverns' part is a bit of a turn off.$7
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.01: シグ！生きとるハチを家に持ち込む気かいな！$5
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sigurd.02: 言うとくけどな、家やなくて地下室に入れるつもりやってん。$12
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.03: なんでやねん！地下室にハチ置いてどうすんの！$9
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sigurd.04: そら...他のハチと合流させるためやろ？$14
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sigurd.05: おばちゃん、見られてんで。$14
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.06: あらまぁ、ごめんなぁ。変な現場見せてもたわ。$5
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.07: うちら顔合わせるんは初めてやないと思うけど、もし忘れてしもてたらあかんから言うとくな。うちはサンドラ・ブレイジア・ベアー。で、こっちが甥っ子のシグ・ベアーやって、
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sigurd.08: オレは『シグ』や。ただの『シグ』。『『シグルド』』でもシギーでもあらへん。『ただのシグ』、ええな？$12
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.09: あんたがこの辺の{{LPJobTitle}}さんやろ？ほんま来てくれてうれしいわ、@！$1
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.10: うちの戸はいつでも開いとるから、おしゃべりでもコーヒーでも、気分転換でも、いつでも寄ってや。$1#$b#ほんまは今すぐでも招き入れたいんやけどな、あ、
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.11: ちょっとハチが暴走気味でな。$5
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sigurd.12: 暴走ちゃう。扉開けといてくれたら、ちゃんと地下室に連れてくねん。$13
MadDogBearFam.16197000.Sondra.14: ごめんな、ハチの件でバタバタしてるんよ。せやけど時間あるときにまた寄ってや、まったりお茶会でもしよな！$1
MadDogBearFam.16197000.message.15: たぶん、確かに歓迎はしてくれてる。サンドラは...。シグルドとハチは...ハチがいないときにまた来よう。
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.02: Hey, can you face my way when you're talking? Batteries are dead. Waiting for Harvey to open up.$11
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.03: Hearing aid. Actually, I'm terrible at lipreading, but at least I'll know you're talking to me.
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.04: No harm, no foul. It's not like I advertise it. Came with my cool face scar during the war.$9
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.06: Whoa, actually asking me about the war?$8#$b#Most folks just tiptoe around the subject awkwardly like I'm a fragile piece of porcelain and not a man built like a bear.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.08: Anyway, Gotoro's a beautiful place, lots of friendly little towns just like this one.#$b#My squad never got sent to the capital, but everyone gushes over the Playwrights' district.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191000.quickQuestionFarm: Sounds like you're avoiding the actual topic of the war...
Did you... get injured in one of those nice little towns?
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.11: Sorry? What was that? I didn't hear you.$9
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.12: Not quite. On the road out of one. Survived, clearly.$2#$b#Some local men warned us not to take the route we did, but orders are orders.
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Sigurd.13: ...I think most Ferngillian residents would find a lot to enjoy in Gotoro, if the war wasn't in the way.
MadDogBearFam.16191000.Harvey.14: Sorry about the delay, Sigurd! Come on in, I *do* have one last battery in stock, it turns out! I'll place an order right away to future proof us both.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.02: Doc Harvey tell you to come after me about smoking?#$b#I think he told all the kids in town to lecture me.$11
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.03: Why smoke? I dunno, it's something to do? Not all of us are fit to work.#$b#Some of us just take up valuable space.$9
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.04: Relax, @. I stick all the butts in my pocket, I'm not littering.$18
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.05: Would it make you feel better if I picked up trash around town for a week?$18
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.06: Come work on the farm? Yikes.$2
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.07: Come on, @. I'm not trying to insult your hard work over at %farm. I'm sorry.$11
MadDogBearFam.16191001.quickQuestionFarm: Yeah, I could use some wood, if you can help.
No, I don't want you smoking on my farm!
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.11: Hey now, these things are bad for your lungs. Can't do manual labor when it's hard to breathe.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.12: Hey now, these things are bad for your lungs.#$b#Can't do manual labor for you when it's hard to breathe, so I won't smoke at %farm.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.13: See, butt in my pocket, pack put away. I'll be on my best behavior, promise.$10
MadDogBearFam.16191001.Sigurd.14: Yeah, yeah, yeah, you sound like Auntie. See ya, @.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Gus.01: You know you're always welcome to dine in, Sig. Both you and Mrs. Sondra are!$1
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.02: She's just 'Ms.' nowadays. And I'm good with takeout, thanks.
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.05: Hey you. Worked up an appetite over at %farm?
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.06: Can't blame you for getting something Gus whips up. Loads better than Army cooking.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Gus.08: Sorry about that, Sig!$2#$b#Here ya go. The bass is real fresh, Willy's catch of the day!$1
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.09: S'fine. Should've been paying attention to my surroundings.$2
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.10: So do you usually hangout at the Saloon in your spare time?#$b#Or are you just here for a meal before you get back to the grind?
MadDogBearFam.16191002.quickQuestionFarm: I swing by to meet up with friends and play pool, any night I can.
I'm just here for a meal, the Saloon's kind of a lot.
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.13: You're a regular social butterfly, huh, @?$1#$b#Well, if it makes you happy, go nuts. We've got everything except for company at the Lodge, so that's good enough for me.
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.14: The Saloon is very much a lot. There's a pool table and video games at the Lodge, so I'm only here for dinner to-go, to be honest.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Sigurd.15: If you ever want a change of pace, pop by. Bring your own dinner though, I sure as {{BearFamProfanityA}} can't cook.$1
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Pam.16: Gus! Sig! How are you boys!
MadDogBearFam.16191002.message.19: Sigurd looks really pale and uncomfortable.
MadDogBearFam.16191002.Gus.23: Poor kid still gets antsy when the place fills up. Never see him here on the weekends.$2
MadDogBearFam.16191002.message.26: For a guy who acts so tough, Sig's kind of sensitive. Hopefully when he gets to know people he can be less anxious.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191111.QuickQuest: Are you actually beekeeping the bees?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191111.MadDog.Has: Hello to you too, @.$12#$b#Well, they're pretty much self-sustaining. I just fake it and they tolerate me.$12#$b#They're a little more lively on Sundays when I come down to harvest the Fersken honey, though.$3
Naw, just harrassin' them.$3#$b#I only harvest the honey on Sundays because that's about how often they produce anything useable from the Fersken tree.$12
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191111.QuickQuest: What happens when the Fersken tree is out of season?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191111.MadDog.Has: Then they just feed off the wildflowers we have around.$12#$b#It's such a bother though, they make honey way faster then meanin' I have to come down here every four days.$14#$b#Like I don't already have enough to do.$14#$b#Well, whatever. If there's honey left behind, feel free to take it.$12

Sure? Stop by on any Sunday and take whatever's left.$12#$b#Oh but come Fall they're feeding off wildflowers, so they make honey more often.$3#$b#It's a pain because I have to jar it more often, practically every four days...What a bother.$14
Anyway, here have a sample, on the hive.$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191111.Message.11: You can now take the honey Sig doesn't jar every Sunday in Spring and Summer, and every four days in Fall, free of charge from the Lodge cellar!
MadDogBearFam.16191003.Sigurd.02: Adventurer's Guild came by earlier. Pulled my fat out of the fire.$2
MadDogBearFam.16191003.Sigurd.03: No, I didn't get hurt. Got lectured. Apparently not supposed to just let those stupid little rock crabs do whatever they want.$8
MadDogBearFam.16191003.Sigurd.06: ...I'm sorry. I - I don't know... It doesn't matter, anymore. I'm tired. I just want... I'll never be able to rejoin the Army again, but...$2
MadDogBearFam.16191003.Sigurd.07: Everyone tells me to try out therapy.$2#$b#That's not a solution, though. It's not fair. I didn't *like* being in the Army but I was a {{BearFamProfanityD}} good soldier.$2#$b#I was doing something with my life, at least.
MadDogBearFam.16191003.Sigurd.08: And it's weak, going to therapy because I'm not allowed to re-enlist and my family and the world has moved on.$2#$b#All because of one stupid - from one -$2
MadDogBearFam.16191003.Sigurd.09: I wish I wasn't so {{BearFamProfanityD}} pathetic. What kind of man am I anymore?$5
MadDogBearFam.16191003.quickQuestionFarm: It's not weak, to ask for help or admit you're afraid or get guidance through big life changes. It's actually very brave.
You didn't die in the war and you've had a lot of time to adjust. Just, do it already and stop moping.
MadDogBearFam.16191003.Sigurd.14: I - I have to go. I'm -$2
MadDogBearFam.16191003.message.15: Will Sig be okay? He seems like he might be at his tipping point.
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Sigurd.2: Hm? Am I in your way or something?
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.4: Well... Do you think you'd mind grabbing that book up there down for me? It's the next one in the series...$2
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.6: Yes! It's finally checked back in!
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Sigurd.7: Oh. Sorry 'bout that, I had it all last week.#$b#I'd have read faster if I knew someone was waiting...$8
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.8: No, that's okay! I've read this series a dozen times now, I wasn't waiting too long!$1#$b#It's kind of my comfort series, actually.
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Sigurd.9: Then it's highly recommended...$18#$b#Ah, admittedly, I never read the series until the movies came out.
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.10: That's alright! As long you give them a try, right?#$b#I'm just glad I get to enjoy them again.
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Sigurd.11: Say, you wouldn't have any recommendations for something similar? Now that I finished off Return of the King, I mean...
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.12: High fantasy? I have plenty!$1#$b#Earthsea is great - that's over here -
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.13: And if you really liked Tolkien's writing specifically, we should get you started on The Fionavar Tapestry.#$b#The author, Guy Gavriel Kay, even worked on The Silmarillion so he knows his stuff.$1
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.14: I'd be happy to find you more books once you finish with these.$1
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.15: !$5#$b#Um... I'm sorry, I got a little over-excited...$2
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Sigurd.16: Wha? No, no, you're fine. I appreciate an enthusiastic endorsement over a soulless online review.$8#$b#I just... already checked out seven books and Gunther keeps me capped at ten...$9
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Sigurd.17: It's not that funny...$18#$b#I'll check out the first books in each series for now and get started that way.
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Penny.18: Meaning you have one more free space left, right?#$b#Can I talk you into something more urban fantasy? How about A Court of Thorns and Roses?$1
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Sigurd.19: I *did* ask for recs, didn't I? Well, go on then, do your worst.$18
MadDog.BearFam.16191001A.Message.20: Between Penny and Sig, the whole library will be cleared out. You better not have to go find THOSE books, next.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.Alex.01: Tunnelers ALL the way to the Superb Owl Bowl this year!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.MadDog.Ha: You're just a huge mark for the Tunnelers, Alex.$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.Alex.06: And *you* have no loyalty to your sports team.#$b#Fair weather fan!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.MadDog.Ha: I was NEVER a Tunnelers guy!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.QuickQues: Are you guys fighting about sports ball of all things?
You guys going to play or gossip?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.MadDog.Ha: Hey-oh @!$1#$b#You wanna be our fourth player?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.Alex.13: Yeah, Shane's definitely going to no-show on us again, besides.$5
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.MadDog.Ha: Hey you.$1#$b#Can you even play gridball, @?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.QuickQues: I don't really like sports, sorry.
I've been WAITING for you guys to ask!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.Alex.19: Hey, more fans in the stands, that's fine by me.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.MadDog.Ha: I get not wanting to *watch* sports, but not even play? Huh. Go figure.
That's super okay, @! Different strokes for different folks, after all!$1#$b#You're welcome to stay and watch, if you want.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.Alex.25: Well, what are we waiting around here for, anyway! Let's play some gridball!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191003A.Message.2: Alex, Sig, and Teren sure seem to be bonding over gridball. Despite their sports fanaticism, it wasn't too bad to hang around with them for a game.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.MadDog.Has: So you probably know why else I'm here.
Anxiety, I presumed.$9
Man's got jokes, everybody.$17#$b#Actually, if you ever bothered to open any mail from the FRA, you'd know why -
I don't care.
- I was selected to get you up to speed on the award ceremony.$17
I still don't care.
-And I'll be the one pinning you, unless you REALLY want ol' Colonel Udina to do it -$17
I don't want the medal.$5
Good news, you're getting two -
Why two? Just because I didn't die? That's ridiculous.$5
Sig. Getting to come home isn't a crime and you have to stop viewing it like that.$2#$b#And you know {{BearFamProfanityD}} well you were up for accolades before -
I don't want the medals. It's - not right, Teren.$5
I think the idea of a medal ceremony is quite lovely, Sigurd darling. We could throw a party.$3
And let the whole town into the Lodge? Pass.$11
You know if Colonel gets involved he'd demand a parade.$17
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.Gus.16: In lieu of a parade, you could have the ceremony here at the Saloon.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.MadDog.Has: Oh, Sigurd, that does sound lovely. Plenty of folks around here like you, they'd love to celebrate your achievement-$1
Absolutely not. There's nothing to celebrate.$5
Sigurd! We'll need to plan this eventually!
Plan it with the dead, they earned those medals more than I ever did.$5
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.QuickQuest: I'm confused, why is Sig getting medals?
This whole thing made Sig really mad.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.MadDog.Has: Because he was a {{BearFamProfanityD}} good soldier. Spent a lot of effort to learn about Gotoro customs and languages, became a real asset when it came to negotiations.$17
He was by all accounts I've heard an excellent soldier, until the accident...$2
The accident took a lot from us. Good friends, Sig's career...$2
Ever since the Army doctors determined he was unfit for service, Sig's been upset.$2
My dear nephew really had his heart set on being a career soldier... He genuinely loved being in Gotoro, spoke the language, partook in the culture norms there...$2
But when the road collapsed under us... well, things changed a lot. And Sig's been understandably upset ever since.$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.QuickQuest: The accident was really that bad?
I don't think you'll be able to give him his medals.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.MadDog.Has: It was the most terrifying day of my life. I... I thought I'd lost Sig that day.$2#$b#I... I lost a lot of people, but somehow me and Big Bear survived.$2
And I'm grateful every day that you two did.$2
Y'know @, I'm afraid you might be right. Big Bear and I went through a lot that day, but he's... he's still carrying the weight of it.$2
I'll never stop being grateful you two came home, but my dear nephew still hurts from it all...$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191004.Message.35: Life can change in an instant but those changes have lasting effects sometimes. This seems to be one of those cases.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191005.MadDog.Has: Sig! Hey, where are you!?
Maybe we shouldn't yell?
Sorry.
You can stay back if you're scared.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191005.QuickQuest: Who's scared? I'm not scared. Are you scared?
Let's keep going, the sooner we find Sig, the sooner we can leave.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191005.MadDog.Has: I'm only scared we won't find Sig...$2#$b#He shouldn't have come down here just because I wasn't able to...$2
I don't care if we have to tear the whole {{BearFamProfanityD}} mountain down, we'll find him.$5
You're right. I don't know what I'll do if we don't find Sig.$2#$b#He shouldn't have come down here just because I wasn't able to...$2
Even if we have to level this whole {{BearFamProfanityD}} mountain, we'll find him.$5
Sig! You're late, you know that, right?
No, I don't see a single sign of him...$2
There'd be something left behind if a monster got him, right?$7
Does that sound like someone fighting monsters to you guys?$17
There's no time to lose!$7
SIG!
BIG BEAR!
Last time I saw Big Bear like this...
Be careful!
Big Bear!
Sig! No!
No. That - that can't happen - not - not again -$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191006.MadDog.Has: Glad to see you conscious again. How's your head?
...Never received any complaints.$18
Sig!
Were you hurt, Gun?$8
I mean, I think I pulled something dragging your gigantic carcass out of there but I -$6
-Saved my life. Gunnar the hero.$18
Don't bully me. I was really scared!$7
Wow, I can't believe both Bears are just natural born heroes.#$b#Some families just get all the luck.$1
Barnes. You alright, too?
All clear, Big Bear.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191006.Harvey.12: Gunnar, do you mind stepping out here with me?#$b#I'll get you set up to take Sigurd home finally.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191006.MadDog.Has: Oh yeah, of course.
So what happened?

Well, you did really well in the 'rescue Gunnar' part of cave exploration... But the second adventure down there was a clear mistake.$17#$b#You know Gun would've been fine making up his work and ore hunting after he recovered, right?$17
Barnes.$8
The ceiling collapsed above you. It was the second time I've had to watch as someone dug you out of a pile of rubble.$2
'm sorry.
...I *hate* caves.
Hey, me too! We gotta stop hanging out in 'em.$1
...I suppose you have a suggestion of where we can hang out instead?$18
Read me like an open book. Come to the next veterans' therapy session with me.#$b#We'll make it a whole boys day.$1
Come on, Big Bear. You've already proven you can handle going into caves when they *don't* fight back.#$b#Now you just gotta face a therapist and win.
First off, that sounds like I'm going to fight a therapist. Second off, I'm not *afraid* of therapists -
Then you'll come with me! Perfect! I'll call and get us in on the next one.$1
Hey... @. You must be real tired of rescuing Bears.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191006.QuickQuest: I guess you guys are an endangered species.
You're going to owe me *so* many chores now.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191006.MadDog.Has: Self-inflicted, at that. What does that make us, koalas?$18
I suppose you're right. Best draw me up a chore chart, @.$1#$b#I prefer gold star stickers, by the way.$18
Thanks, @. Really appreciate you having our collective backs.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191006.Message.32: Sig will be back to full strength in no time, and with friends like you, Teren, and Gunnar supporting him, maybe he'll be able to overcome more of his fears in time.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.MadDog.Has: Hey, {{LPJobTitle}} @! Glad you caught us in time!$1
Don't mind him. He's still a little punchy from the head injury.#$b#We're off to skulk at the Veterans' Hospital for a follow up exam on him, and our therapy session. Exciting stuff, huh?$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.QuickQuest: Are you guys going to be gone for long?
Thank you for looking after him on this trip.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.MadDog.Has: Naw, you can't get rid of us that easily.$1#$b#We'll be back in the Valley sometime late tonight.

Hey, you did a lot of the heavy lifting. Like, all of it, what with the falling rocks and stuff.$2#$b#So, y'know, thank *you* for having his back for me all this time.$1#$b#Besides, it's only one day in the city, how hard can it be to keep an eye on him?$3
Uh oh, that's us. Alright. Happy harvestin', @!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.QuickQuest: You'll be alright, Sig. See you when you come home.
Are you just going to stand there, staring at me?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.MadDog.Has: ...Yeah. Probably. Maybe. Sure hope so. See ya, @. Stay safe.
...Yeah? Maybe. Would really piss off you and Barnes if I did, I reckon.#$b#See ya, @. Stay safe.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.QuickQuest: You better follow your own advice now!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.MadDog.Has: Isn't that what you and Gun are for?
That's what I got you and Gun for.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191007.Message.20: The first part of Sig's journey starts today. Maybe you can check in on him soon and see how the first session went.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008.MadDog.Has: Nice shot, nice shot.
I'm doing a *lot* better now!
Doing great. Might even be able to take money off of Gun or Tere at this rate.$1
Hey you.
Are you here to get lessons?
Sig's teaching me how to play pool!
Fiiiiiine. He's teaching me the *right* way to play pool.
He's good at pool, just like everything he does.$6#$b#He could teach you too, if you needed a lesson!
Don't go volunteering me for stuff.$11
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008.QuickQuest: I'd like to take lessons from you one of these days, Sig.
I could totally beat him in a game of pool, no problem!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008.MadDog.Has: Eh. Don't go around tellin' people but you can bug me anytime for a lesson, @.$1
Oh? Is that so? I'll take any challengers, come on then!$10
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008.QuickQuest: Should I come by the Lodge to play?
It's either here or the Inn, right?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008.MadDog.Has: Ah, well, maybe...
Well, I guess maybe...
We could meet up at the Saloon sometime?$8
On a weekday, prefarably...
I could try a weekend. Or whatever. Whenever you're free.$9
Yeah, yeah. Go shout it on the mountain, why don't you.$11#$b#Just... let me know whenever works for you, or whatever.$18
If it's on a Friday, let me know so we can come back from Zuzu in time!
Kids aren't allowed in the Saloon.
What, after 8 PM?
Ever. It's a new rule Gus announced.$18
You're lying!
It's the truth! Right, @?$18
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008.Message.28: Sig at the Saloon on a Friday night? You'll have to see it to believe it. But if anyone can overcome his fears, you know it's him.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Alex.01: Bummer. What was the other place again?$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.02: Cattails Ranch... and they *also* want ten years of experience.$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.04: Don't give up that quickly, Sig!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Gus.05: Miss Penny's right, Sig, there's something we're missing. I just know it!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.MadDog.Has: Hey you. We're looking for a job.$11
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.08: I don't suppose you have any ideas, @? We'll take all the help we can get!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.QuickQuest: I thought your family was crazy wealthy, Sig?
You're kind of only good for manual labor...
What's been shot down so far?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Gus.12: Sig is wisely deciding to make sure he's self-sufficient.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.MadDog.Has: Pfft, @, you didn't have to kick me while I was down.$9
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.15: We're not really shooting anything down as much as nothing's quite suitable...$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.QuickQuest: Oh, is that all? Just go back to school!
If you're not qualified for something, then get qualified, obviously.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Gus.19: Well, you can always become a chef, Sig!#$b#It's never too late to learn the art of cooking after all!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Alex.20: What, you want him to poison us all? No way!$1#$b#Become a gridball coach, Sig! At least you already do that well!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.22: Gus has a point, in that it's *never* too late to learn something...#$b#And Alex is right in that you do enjoy coaching, after all, he's gotten way better since you two teamed up!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.MadDog.Has: Where ya going with this one, Pen?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.24: You could always go back to school and become a teacher!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.QuickQuest: Well, you *were* teaching Gudrun pool the other day.
Aren't you the one who taught Gun how to fight?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.MadDog.Has: Yeah but that was when we were still kids...
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.29: Well, what else would you be teaching besides kids, Sig?$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Gus.30: Now there's a thought! You could even go on a vacation and leave Sig in charge, Miss Penny!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Alex.31: And you can still be a sports coach in case one of the kids shows a real knack for gridball like I did at that age!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.QuickQuest: You can't tell us after everything you've been through, *children* are going to be your biggest fear?
If all of us think you can do it, then sure, why not?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.35: I can promise you, they're not scary! Every single one of them is a sweetheart!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Alex.36: I can name a dozen more things scarier than the local kids, Sig, c'mon.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Gus.37: And our very own Miss Penny would be happy to guide you along the way, I'm sure.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.38: I'd be happy to help you study so we can become coworkers in the field of education, Sig!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.MadDog.Has: ...Maybe there's a way to do a trial run?$8
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.41: You can do a subsitute lesson! Any topic you want, and I'll help you make a lesson plan!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.QuickQuest: That's giving Sig an awful lot of freedom...
Sig, try not to come up with something boring like the history of gridball.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Gus.45: That's a perfect test topic, Sig!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Alex.46: Yeah, you do know a *lot* about bees and honey, and kids like bugs.#$b#*I* liked bugs when I was a kid, at least.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.MadDog.Has: ...Alright. Okay. I guess I'll 'write up a lesson plan' or whatever... Pen, s'alright if I stop by later with whatever I come up with?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Penny.48: Yes, absolutely! And I'll be there for the day of the lesson, too!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.MadDog.Has: Can I count on your attendance, @?$18
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.QuickQuest: Wouldn't miss it for the world, Mr. Bear!
Oh I *gotta* see how this turns out.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191009.Message.52: Hopefully Sig's bee-based teaching session goes off without a hitch! He and Penny will send you a letter when it's time for class.
Sigurd.JustGotoSchool.Missed.1: The biggest hurdle is unfortunately Sergeant Bear's experience thus far.#$b#The time in the military was by no means a waste, but it doesn't quite equate to a higher education.
Sigurd.JustGotoSchool.Missed.2: Those are all great arguments for it but... Sergeant Bear, your thoughts?
Sigurd.JustGotoSchool.Missed.3: Why not teach about bees, Sergeant? You have become quite knowledgeable on the subject.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.Sebastian: C'mon, soldier boy, I thought you were a GOOD pool player.$7
Here to watch me win every bit of inheritance Sig's ever had?$7
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.MadDog.Ha: Gus'll kick us out long before that EVER happens.$18
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.QuickQues: It's so very weird seeing you here, Sig.
And here I thought we'd finally found someone who could beat Sebastian!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.Sebastian: Sometimes we can't be bothered to go all the way to the Scarp. This is totally normal.
Actually, we were tied for a while but I think I've got 'em now.$7
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.MadDog.Ha: Another round then, if you're going to be so cocky?$18
How'd you sneak past Gus, Gud? You're gonna get in trouble~$18
That's not a real rule, you made it up! It's totally not true!$6
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.Sam.20: You guys CAN'T keep lying to children.$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.Sebastian: Well, how about instead of bullying the littlest Bear, I keep taking money off the biggest Bear?$7
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191008A.MadDog.Ha: Someone's gotta take you down a notch, Seb, and I think I'm the Bear for the job.$18
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191010.MadDog.Has: I'm super proud of you, Big Bear.$1
Hey @! You caught us just in time; made it back from Zuzu a few hours ago.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191010.QuickQuest: Did your guys' session go well?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191010.MadDog.Has: It went really well! Thanks for asking.
Was there supposed to be a finish line?
If it still helps, why stop now?
It's like... growing pains? If that makes sense.#$b#Maybe things are improving... but there are still bad days. So...#$b#%Sig trails off.
I guess it's... *helpful*... to have a support system I can lean on.$9
Yeah, yeah, I know, I can ask you two for help. Don't make a big deal out of it.$18
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191010.Message.16: Sig has grown a lot since he first glowered at you from behind a beehouse. He appreciates your part in his journey even if he won't say it out loud.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: Anyway, that's why pollinator gardens are really important in urban spaces like Zuzu City. Any questions?$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Vincent.02: Is Killer Bees From Outer Space based on a true alien invasion?$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: ...No, it's not. Did your brother let you watch that?$14
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Jas.04: What kind of flowers make the best honey?$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: Well, 'best' is subjective and it depends on how sweet or floral you want your honey.$3#$b#Fairy roses make a valuable, sweet honey, while sunflowers can create a lighter, almost delicate flavor.$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Eloise.06: Do urban cities like Zuzu plan for pollinator gardens?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: Not until recently. The average homeowner, like myself or someday, you, can plan to setup our home gardens so they're pollinator friendly.$12#$b#Whether we're in a city or here in the country side, every bit helps.$3
So... is the next lesson about the birds and the bees?$6
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Eloise.09: I can teach you about birds, Gudrun!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: And Eloise has the floor. Thanks, Professor Bird-facts.$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Penny.12: Sig! You did wonderfully! And I *greatly* appreciate you remembering not to swear in front of the children.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: Hey, c'mon now, my sister's one of those children.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.QuickQuest: So how do you feel? You taught pretty well.
*I* knew a lot of the information already, so you're basically a teacher in my eyes.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Penny.16: @ is right! You *do* already have a knack for it, so what do you think?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: Hey, you come up here and teach 'em next time then.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Penny.18: Well, @'s wealth of knowledge aside, you really showed a knack for it. What do you think, Sig?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: ...I... Well, I didn't *hate* it but... It's a lot of work. I don't know how you do it, Pen.$12
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Penny.20: Well, it is hard work but it's really rewarding, isn't it?$1#$b#That makes it easy when I think about how much I'm helping the children learn and grow.#$b#And besides, Sig - you're no stranger to hard work. Don't sell yourself short after just starting!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.MadDog.Has: Well, if the hardest working people I know - that's the two of you, for the record - think I should try...$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191011.Message.22: It sounds like Sig has made up his mind, thanks to you and Penny supporting him.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: C'mon, Pam, it's like the *only* good thing that developed while I was deployed, for crying out loud.$9
Barnes, c'mon man, speak up. Tell her the truth.$11
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.Pam.05: No way! There's no point to non-alcoholic beer!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: There's tons of microbreweries back in Zuzu that are getting crazy creative with non-alcoholic drinks.$1
We should take a trip just for a brewery tour next time we head into the city.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.Pam.08: If you're gonna drink beer, make it a real beer! That's my policy.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.Gus.09: Sig's right, it's a booming market.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: Oh, Gus, I didn't know you followed the newest trends.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.Gus.11: There's plenty of people who enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of their local Saloon but simply do not drink.#$b#Expanding my non-alcoholic offerings brings the kids like Alex and Haley in.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: And it's *technically* healthy, too.#$b#So if Doc Harvey gets on your case like he does mine...$10
What? He does. But yeah, it's healthier, it brings in a wider variety of customers. It tastes good.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.Pam.16: Alright. Fine, we'll try your way. You and your Sergeant cobble together the best options. Gus, put in an order!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: The Bear family would be happy to sponsor this purchase, Gus.$4
Maybe we oughtta go into the city tonight, Barnes.$1
Pam, you're gonna change your tune, mark my words.$18
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.Pam.20: We'll see about that, tough guy!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: Hey you. You missed most of the debate but Teren and I'll let you know when the nonalcoholic stuff arrives so you can have a round.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.QuickQuest: Kind of sounds gross, but if you're buying, I'm trying.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: Hey, don't knock it til you try it!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.Pam.26: Now there's an idea! Siggy! Buy my rounds, too!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191012.MadDog.Has: Yeah, yeah, as soon as it gets in.$1
Hey, @. You can ask me to buy your next round any time you want.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.Penny.09: Everyone's having a good time, huh?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.MadDog.Has: Yeah, yeah, I'm fine. Noisy, ain't it?$8
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.QuickQuest: You can step out at anytime, Sig.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.MadDog.Has: @ is absolutely right, Big Bear.#$b#Remember when we flipped the truck?
No one was hurt! We just...#$b#Rolled it down a hill... onto a colonel's vehicle.$9
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.Penny.17: Definitely! Take a breather if you need one, Sig!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.MadDog.Has: So far so good. Just a whole lot of people.$8
Well, you've got the medals, so it's not like anyone can say you're a coward, dummy.$3
I know. And it... it doesn't matter. If people did think...$9
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.QuickQuest: That's right! Bravery isn't measured by how much suffering you put yourself through.
You're the only one can call yourself a coward, Sig. No one else holds that power.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.MadDog.Has: Bravery isn't even measurable, no matter how many medals they ask me to stick on you.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.Penny.24: And none of us are going to let you suffer for the sake of it.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.MadDog.Has: And if someone DOES go around calling you a coward, they can answer to me.$3
That's quite the shiny spine you got there, Penny.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.Penny.28: As a teacher, you need one, as Sig is rapidly discovering.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.MadDog.Has: Great {{LPJobTitle}}, great advice-giver, great friend - is there anything you can't do, @?$18
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191013.Message.30: The whole town had a blast at the party and plenty of people came up to Sig to congratulate him on earning his new medals. Sig didn't step outside to smoke even once.
Sigurd.MoTH.Missed.4: The event is for you, after all.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191014.MadDog.Has: Kind of outdated... maybe it's time to order new literature?
I didn't hear you coming, sorry, @.$8
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191014.QuickQuest: Oh shoot, was your hearing aid turned off?
Getting unaware in your old age, huh?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191014.MadDog.Has: I wish I could use that as an excuse this time.$18
Yeah, actually. Totally distracted, didn't know anyone besides Gunther was in here with me.
What am I doing? Putting together materials for class.
It's for the certification classes I'm taking online, actually.$11
It's been a lot of reading - which is fine.#$b#I think Gudrun's tired of fixing my computer though - I dunno why it keeps shutting down, I never used it much before.$8
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191014.QuickQuest: Maybe you should take computer repair classes, too!
Just *what* have you done to the poor thing?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16191014.MadDog.Has: They have clases for ANYthing nowadays, don't they?$8
You sound like Gudrun. I *don't* use the stupid thing, it just never works.$9
...Hey @? I've been meaning to say... thanks.$1
Yeah, yeah, yeah. Enjoy it while it lasts, y'know my base nature is naturally grumpy.$18
I won't be able to help out at the farm if I become a teacher, y'know.
Sigurd.Enrolled.Missed.1: Over there, talking to himself, in a LIBRARY...
event-MadDog.BearFam.SigurdFlirtsBackEve: This one's in pretty bad condition. I can bring my copy and we can trade if you want, Gunther.
'Don't leave now that you're here - Stay.#$b#So the world may become like itself again; so the sky may be the sky.#$b#The road a road, and the glass of wine not a mirror, just a glass of wine.'$1
...Sorry, Gunther didn't warn me folks were around.
event-MadDog.BearFam.ListentoSig.QuickQu: I don't mind hearing you recite poetry to me. (ROMANTIC)
Maybe you'll find your special someone with poetry like that, if you try hard enough!
event-MadDog.BearFam.ListentoSig.Message: Sig is aware you're interested in him.
...Is that so? Hm, maybe I will then.$18
Y'know, maybe you're on to something. Or on something.$18
Thanks for giving me a fair listen this time... Careful who you eavesdrop on though, you never know what it might lead to.
event-MadDog.BearFam.LeaveWithoutListeni: You choose not to listen to Sig recite poetry and leave without making your presence known.
event_SigFlirtsBack_GuntherLineMissed1: Ah, that won't be necessary, Sergeant. But the fact that you have a copy leads me to believe you're a fan of Faiz Ahmed Faiz's work.
event_SigFlirtsBack_GuntherLineMissed2: Now, now, Sergeant, don't be shy! I wouldn't be opposed to hearing you recite a verse or two, if you'd be so kind.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate1.Dialogue.1: Feels bad, stealing you away from %farm... You sure you don't have more important stuff to be doing?$8
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate1.Dialogue.2: You're the important thing I should be doing right now.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate1.Dialogue.3: Chores can wait. I'm choosing to be here.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate1.Dialogue.4: Anytime you want to steal me away to the beach, I'm turning a blind eye to the "crime."
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate1.Dialogue.5: The only thing you should feel bad about is not asking me out sooner - and that's just a joke so don't take it seriously!
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate1.Dialogue.6: You can always make it up to me later, if you're that worried - but I'm not worried one bit.
%Sig raises his eyebrows at the double-entendre, but he runs his hand through his hair before shaking his head and shaking whatever thoughts he was having away.
You're my most important thing, too, @.$4
Do you really mean that Sig?

...I know you do. I've been taking you at your word from day one.$4#$b#You're the most honest person I know, @... and I know you're not the type of person to say pretty poetry at me to get what you want.$1
I do. I've never been more sure of something, @. I've never been so sure of some*one*.$4#$b#You're the type of soul that's kept poets thriving for centuries.$1
Of the two of us, you're the guy with a pretty poem for every moment... so let's hear it.
All you ever have to do is ask, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$18
%Sig leans back on his hands momentarily, clearing his throat before speaking.

'If you could sit with me beside the sea today, and whisper with me sweetest dreamings o’er and o’er';$18#$b#'I think I should not find the clouds so dim and gray, and not so loud the waves complaining at the shore.'$18
You picked that one on purpose.
I'm going to shove you into the complaining waves.
Read me another a verse, oh poet.
You playfully shove at Sig, who laughs and wraps his arm around you, pulling you close into his side. Where he goes, you'll go, he seems to be saying with his actions.

Sig clears his throat again, but pauses, choosing to first wrap his arm around you and pull you close into his side. You can feel the words reverberating in his chest from where you're leaning against him. He's not going to let you go anytime soon.
%Sig makes an overly dramatic gesture of clutching his chest where his heart lays before winking at you.
My oh my, @, outta all the folks in the Valley you chose lil ol' me?$18
You're not little at all, you're a big troll sized dork.
You couldn't have possible expected me to choose someone else.
Alright, so you chose 'big, troll sized me' outta everyone else. Still a shocker.$18
I can still sit in awe that you chose me.$18
You're astounding, @. You take my breath away. You make my heart beat faster every time you glance my way. You give me something to look forward to each day.$4
You do all that to me, too, you know.
...*I* do that to you? Me? Really?

%Sig's grin is infectious, and he pulls you as close as physically possible before resting his head against yours.#$b#Well... let's keep that up then, keep that feeling goin' for each other for as long as we can.$4

%Sig smiles at you tenderly, openly, like your question made his whole year. He pulls you close until there's no space between you and tucks his face against your temple.#$b#Yeah, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, you really do. Really you. No one else could come close to making me feel what you make me feel.$4
Sig can't stop chuckling quietly at your declaration, snatching up one of the long-since forgotten rocks you two were supposed to be skipping and tossing at it at the sea. It skips three times.
Well, you gave me open permission to steal you, and you're forgiving me my crimes... Why, @, is it that you have a thing for bad boys?$18
I *know* you're not trying to pitch yourself as a "bad guy" right now.
Oh you know me, Sig, I like 'em BAD to the BONE!
Hey now! What's that supposed to mean? I've been bad before. {{BearFamProfanityI}}, I could be bad right now.$18
%Sig reaches out and gently pushes you just enough that you slide forward on the dock a few centimeters. He smirks at you.
Oh, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}, you are just in luck. *I'm* bad at everything.$10

%Sig jostles himself, bumping your shoulder briefly before sliding himself far enough off the dock that his shoes touch the water. Apparently the threat of wet shoes means nothing in pursuit of proving his 'point'.
You don't have to be anything different that exactly you are. I like you as you are.
You could be the baddest person in the Valley and I'd still think you were just perfect for me.
Sig looks shocked briefly, not expecting such a claim. He wraps his arms around you and tucks his chin against your shoulder as if to make sure you wouldn't feel the urge to take those words back.
*You're* perfect. Not just for me. For this whole {{BearFamProfanityD}} world.$4
Sig pulls you into a hug, nearly dragging you into his lap, as if you'd suddenly form any plans to run off and find yourself someone actually more perfect for you.
In my defense, d'you have any idea how long it took me to collect enough flat rocks for skippin'?$18
Pick up a beige rock and skip it.
Pick up an oblong rock and skip it.
Pick up a cracked rock and skip it.
It skips 4 times.
Ooh, nice.
It skips 8 times.
...How the {{BearFamProfanityA}} did you do that, @?$8
It sinks immediately, splashing you both.
I didn't see nothing.
I can't believe this is your idea of a date.
Now you skip one.
I *did* say I'd take you on a date unlike any you'd ever been on before.$10
%Sig grabs a rock without even looking and throws it. It skips 3 times.
Aw, rock.
Reach for another rock.
Before you can select from the remaining rocks, Sig snatches one up. The army taught him to be prepared, so it's no surprise to see him pull a pencil seemingly out of nowhere.
...Even if the writing fades away... even if the rock wears down...$4
The rock is warm from being in his hands. In dark pencil lead, you read your name plus his name forever, in a little crookedly drawn heart.
Skip it.
Keep it.
%Sig lays his head on your shoulder as you prepare to throw the rock. It skips 11 times. It's the best you two have done all day.

%Sig watches you close your fingers around the rock and tuck it away with big, dark, soft eyes. A little chuckle huffs out of him, and he lays his head on your shoulder. The rest of the rocks lay forgotten... but that's alright.
%Sig hums thoughtfully.#$b#Make it up to you later you say? You just wanna get me all sweaty and disheveled on your property.$18
I'm preparing an itemized to-do list for you now.
Is the first thing on the to-do list 'you'?$18
Hey, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA }}? You know if you asked I'd do everything I could for you, right?$4
I do. But I like hearing you remind me when we get moments like this.
I'm not going to ask you for everything... just for some time together, just like this.
%Sig slides his arm around your waist and pulls himself closer to you until there's no longer a gap between you.#$b#I'll remind you as much as you want, no matter the moment.$4
%Sig moves to wrap his arm around your waist, pulling you until you're tucked safely against his side.#$b#I'll clear my schedule for the rest of my life, then, just for you.$4
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.2: I had you on the ropes!
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.3: I'm going to ask Sebastian for tips.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.6: You very much did this time, I won't deny it.$1
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.7: ...Hold on now, don't ask another guy to do it.$8
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.8: Really, @, you're {{BearFamProfanityD}} good at this, whether it's my fault or not -$1
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.11: As I was saying - before you so rudely interrupted me -$1
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.12: I don't see why we're not making a little wager here.$18
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.13: If I win, it's a secret.$10#$b#If you SOMEHOW win - well, you go ahead and name your prize.$18
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.15: I can picture it now - lounging on the porch while *you* do all my work for a week.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.16: Sig racks up the balls again and nods to you. He always lets you go first.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.18: Make him take the break shot.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.19: You take the break shot and scatter everything. Red stripe is the first to fall to you, followed quickly by green, then yellow, before you miss the fourth shot.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.20: Sig takes the break shot and sends balls in every direction. You watch him as he calls out and sinks three solids before missing the fourth - aiming precisely around the 8 ball that managed to be in his way each time.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.21: It's your turn after Sig, and you have your shot lined up perfectly when Sig abruptly speaks up.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.22: Wanna hear what I'm gonna do with you when I win?$18
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.23: Your beautifully positioned shot gets thrown off just enough by how exceedingly *smug* Sig sounds, and you watch in dismay as the cue ball ignores the orange stripe you had your heart set on.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.24: Alright you two, cool it in there.
MadDog.BearFam.SigDate2.Dialogue.26: This game goes to Sig in the end, but he offers you double or nothing and who are you to decline such an opportunity? This round for sure will go to you.
MadDog.BearFam.SigurdProposalEvent.Dialo: So let me get this straight, @. You managed to find some small little bit of space on your farm that you're not sure what to do with yet?#$b#Surely Robin's got some hidden blueprint or Pierre's got some interesting sapling for you to grow.$18
Ask Sig what he thinks he you should do.
You already know what I'm going to say. You should fill it with bees.$10
*You* should fill it with bees. (Propose to Sig)
I'm not the hobbyist beekeeper here. (Be proposed to by Sig)
That... that sounds an awful lot like an invite to move in.$8

...@... {{CPSigurdSpouseNameA}}... are you - are you sure? Me of all the folks in this wide world, to stand at your side?$8#$b#...Well, {{BearFamProfanityD}}, doesn't this just beat all? Yes. Ten thousand times yes, @. I love you, mind, soul, and body.$4
Well... it's not too late to become a beekeeper's keeper, @. Marry me. Make me the happiest man in the Republic.$4
You know, I'll do my {{BearFamProfanityD}} best for you. You make me try to be better every day - you won't want for a single thing if you'll have me.$4
You and Sig are now engaged! Congratulations!
MadDog.BearFam.MarriedSigCooksPart1.Dial: ...It needs work, but it's edible. It's time.
It's not bad, actually! I think you're ready.
If it needs work, it's *not* time.
Bad doesn't mean it's good enough though.
You've been taking lessons from Auntie and Gus, don't you want to prove to them you've learned something?
I mean, I'm forever willing to be your taste tester, but I'm *also* in love with you, so I might be biased.
I've learned plenty of other things from the pair of them.Things that *won't* result in me poisoning half the town with my cooking.$8
I distinctly recall a few meals back where even your willingness was struggling, oh biased {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA }} of mine.$18
You've improved! You're the one who declared you'd master cooking to become a better househusband for me. So now, it's time to test your skills.
...Well, I do love you and want to be the best househusband for you...$4
You're already the best househusband I could ask for, but I'm going to hold you to your word... And I love you too.

Well, can't argue with the head {{LPJobTitle}} in charge.$1#$b#I'll call up Gus. We should have everything set up in the next three days... which gives plenty of time for people to make their wills and last testaments.$18
MadDog.BearFam.MarriedSigCooksPart2.Dial: Not looking good out there... no one looks happy.
Don't be such a pessimist! I'll go out and scout around and prove you wrong.
It's okay to be nervous, but I think it's fine. I'll go see how people are feeling, okay?
Marlon and Marnie look like they're deep in conversation... but their plates are empty!
Hope your night's going well, folks.
Do you want the cold, hard, brutal truth?
You're always my straight shooter, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. Hit me.$8
You did amazing. Everyone's having a good time.
Gus and Emily are at the bar with nothing to do, that's how well you've done.
I could've NEVER done this without you, @. Your love and support makes me feel like I can do anything. Thank you.$4
I feel the same way... and you better watch out, because we're stealing Teren's cookbook and turning you into a baker, next!
MadDog.BearFam.MarriedSigDateCity.Dialog: I'm really glad we got to do this, @... I know you're not easily impressed but I hope I was able to wow you just a little tonight.$22
You wow me everyday, Sig.
Well, I'm not going to say 'no' to a little spoiling, Sig.
I'm really glad you brought me out tonight, Sig.
Impossible. I don't do even a tenth of what you to do, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}. But I can do my part, at least.$23
Oh, I should up my game a little more then. Don't worry, I still have something up my sleeve.$23
It's nice to get away from the Valley... but admittedly, I'm also looking forward to being the guy that brings you home.$23
There's one last thing I want you to see before we go home. Come over to the window with me.$22

Sig joins you before you both walk over to the window. You take his hand in yours. It's not really necessary when the window's right there, but his palm is warm against yours and he immediately intertwines your fingers together.
Wow, the city looks gorgeous like this!
Nice view. What are we looking for? Can we see your grandmother's estate from here?
Well, not near as gorgeous as you, but it comes {{BearFamProfanityD}} close.$23
Thankfully, no. We're lucky enough to avoid *that* eyesore.$23
Just a few more moments...$22
Yeah, that's what I was waitin' for.$23
...Did you make a wish?$22
Why would I wish for anything beyond what you and I already have?
I did. But it's a secret.
Bigger farm? Spare husband? A sibling for %pet? The night sky's the limit, {{LPSigurdSpouseNameA}}.$23
Keep your secret wish. I'll do everything I can to make it come true - even if I don't know what it is.$23
Did you make a wish?
I did. The same wish I make on every star I find. That you and I stay happy together, forever. I love you, @.$22
I love you, too, Sig.
MadDogBearFam.16194000.Haley.01: So... that's all you do? Take photos of... fish and sand?$2
MadDogBearFam.16194000.Gudrun.02: Then I post about them online.#$b#Do you know we discover about sixty new aquatic species each year?$1
MadDogBearFam.16194000.Haley.03: Oh! You want to become Qinstafamous for finding a new fish?$1

MadDogBearFam.16194001.Pierre.02: I'm not sure that would increase profit at all, Gudrun.$2

MadDogBearFam.16194001.Abigail.17: He's always like this.$2#$b#Your ideas are pretty solid. If you ever want to stage a protest outside the supermarket to bother Morris, I'd be down to wave a sign around, chant some slogans.$1

event-MadDog.BearFam.16194007.QuickQuest: You'll be okay, whatever the future holds.
Remember, if they make you go to business school, you can just run away again.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194007.Message.17: It looks like all's well that end's well. Everything's back to normal in the Bear household once more.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194007.MadDog.Has: By the way, what's for supper?$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194007.Message.21: Yep. Everything's DEFINITELY back to normal.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Pierre.01: Good day, @. Hope you're doing better than me and mine.$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.QuickQuest: Actually, I'm not doing too hot. Got the strangest letter from Joja.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Pierre.04: Morris and his awful Joja Corp!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Pierre.05: Don't tell me... You got a letter from Joja, too?!$4
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Abigail.06: They hit a few of us, but dad and -$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Pierre.07: *I'm* an adult businessman but to sink so low as to target a child!? I won't stand for it!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Pierre.08: I'll just need to make time to go check in on that poor young lady and make sure she's not too troubled.$2#$b#Say, she attends a class at the Library, right?$4
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Pierre.10: Then I will make sure this nasty business with Joja hasn't scared her any!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Abigail.11: Kind of hard to imagine Gudrun scared of anything from *Joja*...$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194008.Message.12: Hopefully Joja is just blowing a bunch of hot air, but it's nice of Pierre to worry about Gudrun.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Penny.01: Hm, it looks like this would require more language studies.#$b#Scientific names are really fun though, you can ask Maru!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Vincent.04: What's the scientific name for a largemouth bass?$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Penny.07: Oh, that's right, it says so here on this illustration!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Penny.09: Let's see. It should be here on this page right?$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Eloise.11: But the largemouth bass is a lake fish, so maybe you wouldn't have to know that name.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Jas.12: Yeah, Gudrun, you should memorize ocean fish names for college!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.15: Oh, good - Miss Gudrun! I wanted to check in with you - I spoke with your aunt and she said you all had things handled but -$4
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.MadDog.Has: ...The Joja thing? Sorry about that, Mr. Pierre. Auntie said the family'd cover any issues on your side, too. Did she have a chance to tell you that?$13
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.17: Oh yes! Mrs. Sondra was quite thorough with everything.#$b#And I'm relieved to see you're not feeling stressed from the hassle and are back to focusing on your future!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.18: Although... Miss Gudrun, can we talk business briefly?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.MadDog.Has: Uh... I don't want a part-time job, Mr. Pierre.$6
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Haley.20: The last one was too scary.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Abigail.21: Are you kidding? I loved it!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.22: No, no, I don't think you'd be suited for the austerity of Pierre's General Goods. In fact, I've sort of gathered you weren't *thrilled* about attending college and I thought, having gotten my dear Abby set up, I could extend some advice?$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.MadDog.Has: Lots of kids grow up to be marine biologists, it's not weird...$13
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Jas.25: I wanna be a chicken biologist. Eloise and I can go to the same classes together!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.26: Of course it's not weird! But Miss Gudrun, you have proven to be a smart, determined young lady - and you clearly have a passion against mega corporations being allowed to do as they please... Why, have you ever considered focusing on that?$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.QuickQuest: Oh, like going into a major that would let her fight corporations?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.29: Ahh, let me explain more clearly.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.31: Have you ever considered going to law school? You enjoy arguing with authority, and the environment could always use a human legal representative!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.QuickQuest: Well, you do like arguing, Gudrun.
You do care about defending the environment.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.MadDogHash: So, like, going to school to be an environmental protections lawyer?$6#$b#...But marine life...$13
So, like, going to school to be an environmental protections lawyer?$6#$b#...But marine life...$13
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.36: Why, my brilliant Abigail takes electives all the time! This semester she's enrolled in 'Intro to Trebuchets'.#$b#There's no reason you *can't* study both fields, and if you need help with building better study habits, I'm sure Miss Penny or my Abby could help!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.40: If she goes to law school, her first target will be Joja, we all know it.#$b#I can't say I'm torn up about them getting her wrath through *legal* routes in the future.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194009.Pierre.41: If she goes to law school, her first target will be Joja, we all know it.#$b#I can't say I'm torn up about them getting her wrath through *legal* routes in the future.$1
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.1: We were *so* gonna leave without you, @. Everyone's already on the bus!$6
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.2: ...Wait, I think Alex's dog ate my homework!
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.3: Let's go check out fish class 101, Gudrun!
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.7: The classroom is buzzing with chatter as students are deep in their work on aquatic life. Feel free to look around and follow up with Gudrun if you've seen enough.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.10: Check out the strange fish machine.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.12: See how Pierre and Sondra are doing.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.14: You've seen enough, check in with Gudrun.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.17: Go to a different part of the classroom.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.22: Do you think maybe... Mr. Pierre has a point?$13
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.23: I think you could accomplish anything you wanted to.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.24: I think you'd be able to stick it to Joja and other mega corporations if you took his advice.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.25: Why stress? You already know all about fish - take the easy route, forget the hard fight.
MadDog.BearFam.16194010.Dialogue.26: ...Thanks, @. You - and Mr. Pierre - have given me plenty more to think about.$1
GudrunOnCampus.Message.1: Grumpy green spiky headed student: '*WHO* keeps putting the Encyclopedia of Underwater Fungal Growths back wet!?!?'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.2: Frantic blond typing student: 'Uhhh, I can't talk right now, I haven't attended class all year, please, I am going to FAIL!'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.3: No headband studious sister: 'Ugh, I can't focus today... she's totally copying me, isn't she? Just let me be the FASHIONABLE one for once.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.4: Headband wearing studious sister: 'My sister's TOTALLY not focusing today... she thinks the fish is copying her style, um, like hello? It's a fish.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.5: PhD in shrimp logistics student: 'This is shrimply fascinating... Ah, sorry, I'm too busy to chat right now... but don't call me shellfish for being dedicated to my work!'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.6: Blue haired student who was SUPPOSED to be recording data: 'I can't wait until I have my own lab... I'm going to hire an intelligent redheaded assistant and be entirely devoted to my studies.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.7: Professor Whilliam Whale: 'Hm, yes, quite... But will she?'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.8: Teaching Assistant Tomas Trout: 'Oh, indubitably, but won't she?'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.9: Blue haired student who should try solid food: 'Aw, man, they're out of Joja Cherry XXXTreme again? Well there goes MY dinner plans.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.10: Worryingly damp undergrad: 'I swear I put the Encyclopedia of Underwater Fungal Growths back, but I just can't find it... And I don't want to grab any other text books til my hands are dry.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.11: Fish rehab major: 'This is the Fish Rehabilitator 9000. We'd have the 10000, but our funding's kind of tight this time of year... Maybe next year we'll be over 9000.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.12: Punk student with a heart of gold: 'Hey, you stopped by on a good day! Usually these two are fighting.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.13: Ethically compromised redheaded student: 'Our latest research subjects have been really irritable lately... Mind you, these were all sourced by Joja so I suspect there's a correlation. But the funding!'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.14: This mounted fish has a brass plate that reads 'In Honor of Dr. Edgar Allan Roe, Esquire'.
GudrunOnCampus.Message.15: The Fish Rehabilitator 9000 is humming along, apparently rehabilitating a rainbow trout.
GudrunOnCampus.Message.16: The scribblings on these essay pages look like the ramblings of a fish obsessed maniac... Gudrun's going to fit right in!
GudrunOnCampus.Message.17: The Deep Blue Conundrum, Foreword by Dylan Moray. There's a review by Rodney O'Brien on the back that reads: 'I don't care about fish.' Inspirational!
GudrunOnCampus.Message.18: It's shopping list. At the top is, unsurprisingly, 'food for fish'. At the bottom is 'more cases of Joja Cherry XXXtreme'.
GudrunOnCampus.Message.19: Why does the person on the cover for 'The Old Man and The Sea' look like Willy?
GudrunOnCampus.Message.20: Most of the books on the shelves look like they've been well-used, and they all vaguely smell damp. Does no one in this field care about anything besides fish?
GudrunOnCampus.Message.21: Why is the light blinking? Why do none of these students seem worried about the fish lights blinking!?
GudrunOnCampus.Message.22: There's lots of scientific equipment spread around the classroom... and it all REEKS of fish.
GudrunOnCampus.Message.23: 'WET AND WILD WOBBEGONG IN YOUR AREA! CALL XXX-YYY-0000 AND FLEX YOUR FINS TODAY!' ...Well, that explains why it's in the garbage.
GudrunOnCampus.Message.24: 'Joja Corp is proud to sponsor ZuCU's Aquatic Research Department! Join Us! Thrive!'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.25: This painting has a dedication. 'Seek lore and knowledge, and through sharing both you will always find friendship and warmth.'
GudrunOnCampus.Message.26: The textbook and desktop are absolutely soaked with salt water. Hopefully it's at least fresh?
GudrunOnCampus.Message.27: 'When the World Expands, so does Water', a collection of short essays from various highly acclaimed contributors such as Lemurkat, Flashshifter, Rafseazz, Lumisteria, Skellady, HarvzBack, and more!
GudrunOnCampus.Message.28: The fish are very determined to stay out of each other's way... and the tank smells like cola. That's probably not related.
GudrunOnCampus.Message.29: There's a lot of technical read outs scrolling on the screen. The word fish appears in practically every line!
GudrunOnCampus.Message.30: The chemical makeup of a Joja Cola is listed on the screen. The students have been narrowing down which component might be causing fish to form an underwater fight club.
GudrunOnCampus.SondraSpeak: Oh, don't mind me, dear, I'm just keen to stay out of the way in case there's any fish-idents.$1
GudrunOnCampus.HaleySpeak: Hmmm... I'm not into marine life like Gudrun, but some of the colorings are pretty. They'd be good photo subjects if this lab wasn't so stark and soulless!$3
GudrunOnCampus.AbigailSpeak: Wow, these shrimp look super healthy, right @? I'm glad to see the students take good care of them even if they aren't 'pets'.$1
GudrunOnCampus.PierreSpeak: '...All this money and it's dedicated to studying fish of all things. School was different back in my day.$2
GudrunOnCampus.NoraSpeak: I hope we have time to visit the Reptile Rooms. ZuCU has some of the best facilities for animal studies, I really admire their dedication to animal welfare.$1
GudrunOnCampus.GudrunSpeak: ...It's nice, isn't? It's a cool classroom...$13
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Penny.01: I think I've heard good things about this scholarship.#$b#Actually, we should note it for Jas and Eloise, too!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Vincent.03: An essay is a kind of snail. I can help you, Jas, I know all about snails.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDog.Has: I don't really need the scholarship part... but it'll help my application, right?$13
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Haley.08: I don't get it. Why are you worried now? You're like, fourteen, that's way too soon to be stressing you out about college.$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Penny.11: It's a good plan to start young! We don't want Gudrun to miss any opportunities, right?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Pierre.15: Oh, Miss Gudrun! I'm so glad I found you before *he* did!$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDogDobs: You're the little rapscallion that's been blogging all those nasty accusations about Joja, aren't you?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Vincent.17: My friend Gudrun's not a reptilian!$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Pierre.19: You listen here! No one comes into our nice caring community and starts suing our children!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDogDobs: She's in violation of the terms and covenants outlined in J9951, pursuant to harassment, pursuant to unlawful gathering -$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Pierre.21: Don't look so ghoulishly happy when you're reciting that jargon, and put down your phone -!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDog.Has: Sir, I must insist that you abide by the agreement drafted by -$5
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDogDobs: It was perversion of justice and our legal right as a corporate entity to continue to adhere to the terms outlined in that laughable agreement you drafted -$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDog.Has: Not to 'well actually' you or anything, Mr. Too Good For Introductions, but Joja Corp is in violation of environmental preservation ordinance CA-2016.$6#$b#Which states that grocers that do NOT run off solar, wind, or water power must provide door to door recycling and grocery delivery to residents and local businesses.$6
Your store relied on coal power from the local mines, meaning your company owes back-services in excess of twenty years in the form of monetary compensation.$6
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDogDobs: I - I don't think that - that can't be true -$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.QuickQuest: Pretty sure it is. I think I filed a report about that one time when I worked there.
Our Gudrun might be a reptile, but she's no liar.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDogDobs: I'll be back! Joja ALWAYS comes back!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Pierre.36: I KNEW you'd be able to make those middle manager types squirm, Miss Gudrun! Excellent work!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.MadDog.Has: It's important to have dreams... but it's more important to protect those dreams, right?$1
It's important to have dreams... but it's more important to protect those dreams, right?$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16194011.Vincent.41: But why'd that guy call you a reptile, Gudrun?$3
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sebastian.02: I'm never wrong about these things.
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.04: Ma'am, are you okay? Do you need any assistance?
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sondra.05: Oh, no, I'm fine, thank you for asking.
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.06: Would you like me to carry your bags for you?#$b#It's a bit of a trek back to the Scarp still.$2
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.08: Really, it's no trouble at all, right Seb?$3
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.09: Anyway, I can consider it part of my latest serving of community service.$1
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sondra.10: Ah, are you one of {{LewisOrLouise}}'s troublemakers?$1
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.12: Er... yeah. Did {{LewisOrLouisePronoun1}} really mention me to you? Oh no.$5#$b#Oh, but even if I *wasn't* stuck with community service at the moment, I was still raised right!$8#$b#A little old lady struggling with her groceries? My mom would be really mad if I didn't try to help!$1
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.14: We'll follow your lead, ma'am. That way we can walk as slow as you need to, alright?
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sondra.15: Ahh... Thank you, you're very kind. You're Jodi's oldest, right? And Robin's oldest?
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sondra.16: Wonderful. I thank you both for taking the time to help...#$b#a little old lady like me out.$2
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.17: Of course! Say, you're from Zuzu right?
MadDogBearFam.16192000.Sam.19: What's the music scene like there? Are there still a lot of indie bands?
MadDogBearFam.16192000.message.20: Sam probably could've been a little more gentle with the little old lady remarks, but it looks like Sondra might've found some fellow music enjoyers to chat with.
MadDogBearFam.16192001.George.01: Hmmm? Wait just a minute, I know you!
MadDogBearFam.16192001.George.03: You're little Wulfram's gal, aren't you? The accountant?$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Evelyn.04: Oh, goodness, she is, isn't she! Miss Sondra Brazier. Sondra Bear now, I suppose!$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Sondra.05: It's been quite a while since anyone's called me Wulfram's girl.$1#$b#Let me see, George and Evelyn Mullner - you must've been acquaintances with Wulf's father Torsten?
MadDogBearFam.16192001.George.07: Good ol' Torsten Bear. Never thought he stick to the family business.$1#$b#He had his head in the clouds all throughout our childhood, that rascal.$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Evelyn.08: And my gosh, how little Wulfram was so much like him as a child.#$b#I remember chasing him all over creation way back when Torsten and Frida would still visit!$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Sondra.09: Oh, Wulf never changed. Always chasing the next exciting thing - new musicians, new songs, new shows, you name it.$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.George.10: Still avoiding the family business after all these years?#$b#He really is Torsten's boy, through and through.$1#$b#Arne and Yrsa had the better minds for it, besides.
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Sondra.11: Oh, no... Wulf never really signed on. He struck it out on his own until the very end, with Torsten's blessing.$2
MadDogBearFam.16192001.George.12: ...The end, you say?$2#$b#I take that to mean you're Wulf's widow now, then?$2
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Evelyn.13: I'm so sorry for your loss!
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Sondra.14: Wulf passed a few years back, I'm afraid.$2#$b#But please, it's so nice to hear people talk of his childhood. I only met him in college, you see...
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Evelyn.15: Dear, why don't you come over for a late lunch with us and we can tell you more tales, if you'd like?$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.George.16: I'll bet Frida only ever talks about his accomplishments, but we can tell you about the time Wulf flooded the creek and pinned it on Arne.$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Sondra.18: Did he really? I would love to join you both, if I'm not imposing?
MadDogBearFam.16192001.Evelyn.19: Of course not, please. We'd be delighted to chat about the old days. You come right with us!$1
MadDogBearFam.16192001.George.20: We have to tell her about the time -
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Gus.01: Go on and take a look!
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Gus.02: You're welcome to check out the music selection, too, @. There's not *much* to select though, I'm afraid.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.MadDog.Has: Hello @ dear. Shall we see what music is available to us? What track should we listen to, Banjo Bop, O'er the Valley, or Music Box Memory?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.QuickQuest: I hope Music Box Memory isn't sad.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.MadDog.Has: Oh... dear, not quite upbeat, is it?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Sam.11: You can try all you want, Mrs. Sondra, but the choices aren't that great.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.MadDog.Has: Hello Sam! It's lovely to see you. Now, as I recall, *you* write music. Why haven't we expanded the jukebox selection to include your work?$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Sam.13: Oh - well, I'm not that good.$4
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Sam.15: Besides, all I have is tapes - the jukebox won't play casettes.$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.MadDog.Has: Oh, there we go, Sam! You should record a demo album!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Sam.18: We're not ready to record anything! And we've never had a gig outside of town yet, so no one would want our demo.$8
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.MadDog.Has: Then all the more reason to record a demo!#3#$b#Sam, having a demo record that plays here where tourists might stop by is a great way to get exposure.$1#$b#And maybe they'll even request a copy!$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.QuickQuest: I'd listen to your demo, Sam.
If people don't like it, there's still other albums in the jukebox.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Sam.25: As long as they don't do that when I'm here.$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Sam.27: You're forgetting a big part of all this, @, Mrs. Sondra...$2#$b#Traveling to a recording studio and recording an album costs money!$8
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.MadDog.Has: There's a solution for that, I just know it!$11#$b#Let me think up some options and we'll reconvene, alright?$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.QuickQuest: I'm happy to help if I can!
Better keep practicing in the meantime, Sam.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002.Message.31: Sondra's an accountant, she can probably figure out all kinds of ways for Sam to make recording money, right?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Evely: This has just been absolutely lovely, Sondra my dear.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.MadDo: Oh, I agree! I'm ever so glad you and George made time for lunch with me.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Georg: We would anytime, girl! Us oldies gotta stick together!$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.MadDo: Too true, George. Well, I'll just go settle our bill with Gus -
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Evely: Oh, gracious me, Sondra, I could never let you!$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Georg: Of course, we'll handle it! You're our guest -
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.MadDo: Oh, but I invited you, I should cover it -$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Georg: We're covering this one, and I won't hear another word otherwise!$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.MadDo: Nonsense, George, it's truly the least I can do after you so kindly joined me.$2
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Quick: Maybe you guys can go halfsies?
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.MadDo: Oh of course, dear @. We're just having a nice light lunch.$1
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Evely: And it's good to see you, @. I hope you're having a lovely day.
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Georg: Bah, can't you see we're taking care of it?$3
event-MadDog.BearFam.16192002Bonus.Evely: Oh, but there's two of us and only one of dear Sondra, that's not fair at all.$2
